==Music Room==
{{MusicRoom |category =Title screen |title =向着喧嚣的寂然之世 ～ Narration of Deceased |titleEN =A Silent World Looking Towards Cacaphony ~ Narration of Deceased |composer =残实 |comment =被拜托了「写的不要太过于东方喔」，
所以东方标志性的主旋律我就好好地藏在曲子里面了。
总之是以浓厚的历史感与神秘感为印象写下的曲子，
听的时候能有一步一步探寻深秘的感觉就好了吧。
——残实
「从死者的言语中构想出的寂然之世」，就是这样的感觉了。
不管是低声的诉说还是怨气的发散，都有被倾听着，
是属于故去者之间的浪漫吧。
但是本次异变中的怨灵数量真是多得过分（充满自知之明的吐槽）。
——狸糕子 |translation =I was told to "not make it too Touhou",
so I hid the iconic Touhou main theme in the track.
Anyways, the track was composed with a heavy impression of "history" and "mystery",
when listening to it, you should have a feeling of slowly uncovering a mystery step by step.
——残实
"A silent world constructed from the words of the dead", that kind of feeling.
Both the soft, speaking voices and the spreading air of resentment are being heard,
as a sort of romance among those that have departed.
But the number of vengeful spirits in this time's incident is a bit too high (self roast).
——狸糕子 }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 1 Theme |title =散雪之夕行 |titleEN =Evening Walk Among the Scattered Snow |composer =Pidove |comment =第一面的主题曲。
（作为开场曲似乎是不太常见的风格。
黄昏时刻大家都会这样吧，不知为啥就不想行动了。
这可怎么行，故事好像讲不下去了，所以要像副歌的小号一样啊。
不过为什么是我在说这些呢，
对啊为什么？）
——Pidove |translation =Stage 1 Theme.
(This is a bit of an uncommon style for the opening track.
Everyone's like this during dusk, for some reason no one wants to do anything anymore.
But we can't have that, or else the story can't go on. So that's why we have to be like the trumpets in the chorus.
But anyways, why am I the saying these things...
yeah, why?)
——Pidove }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 1 Boss - Chiamaki Tenseibou's Theme |title =Glaciated Gloam ～ 未鸣七弦 |titleEN =Glaciated Gloam ~ The Unresonant Seven Strings |composer =灵猫子 |comment =天青坊 知雨姬的主题曲。
没有信仰的神明难以逃离消失的命运，因此是一个充满悲伤感的人物，
因此在曲子的编配上比较压抑，不过小号仍然能把整体的情绪变得激昂了。
——灵猫子 |translation =Chiamaki Tenseibou's Theme.
A God without faith cannot escape their fate of disappearance, so she's a character laden with sorrow,
so in the track, the arrangement was made more restrained.
But the trumpets are still able to make the mood as a whole quite exciting.
——灵猫子 }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 2 Theme |title =星潮莳夜歌 ～ Aflame Inviolable Illusion |titleEN =Nocturne of the Swelling Celestial Tides ~ Aflame Inviolable Illusion |composer =H2SO4 |comment =第二面的主题曲。
月夜的通路，在晚樱的点缀之下显得尤为静谧。
所以就尝试用柔和的曲风写成了相当安静的曲子。
用大提琴、排箫、笛子等等乐器写了很多条交织在一起的旋律线，
并用能想到的最优美的旋律之一用来当每一段的主旋律。
听着仿佛就像能看到天边的银河在静静地流转。
——H2SO4 |translation =Stage 2 Theme.
The moonlit road under the embellishment of the night sakura is especially tranquil,
so I tried using using a more tender style and composed a track that was relatively peaceful.
I used cello, pan-pipes, dizi, and similar instruments to compose many interweaving melodic lines,
and used the most beautiful melody among them as the main melody of each section.
Listening to it, you can imagine seeing the Milky Way flowing quietly high in the sky.
——H2SO4 }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 2 Boss - Annika A.T.B. von Hohenheim's Theme |title =赤蔷薇的瓶中庭 ～ Demiurge of Gloriosa |titleEN =Bottled Garden of the Scarlet Rose ~ Demiurge of Gloriosa |composer =H2SO4 & 灵猫子 |comment =安妮卡·A·T·B·冯·霍恩海姆的主题曲。
因为和炼金术士和蔷薇相关，
便尝试在写的时候融入了一些西洋的风格——大键琴、手风琴和提琴。
可以说是一首很特别的在前3面的boss曲了，
激烈的古典和合成器，简单而优美的旋律都预示着要面对的这个家伙似乎不简单。
——H2SO4 |translation =Annika A.T.B. von Hohenheim's Theme.
Because her character is related to alchemy and roses,
I tried to add some western style -- organ, accordion, and the strings.
It's quite unique for an early-game boss.
An exciting mixture of classical and synthesized instruments and a simple yet elegant melody both hint that there's more to this character than meets the eye.
——H2SO4 }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 3 Theme |title =樱下的雅集 ～ Sacrificial Poem |titleEN =Distinguished Assembly Under the Sakura ~ Sacrificial Poem |composer =小闰_YAN |comment =第三面的主题曲。
通往灵界的路上总是人迹罕至呢。这也无怪，本身那里就不是活人应该前往的地方
——不过幻想乡并不存在这样的约束就是了。
可真的踏上这条路的话，多少会眷恋人世吧。
怀着这种想法，我在最初写这首曲子时希望写的充满空灵感与怀旧感，
在这种氛围下穿梭在弹幕之中。
希望真的有这种感觉ww
——小闰 |translation =Stage 3 Theme.
The road to the netherworld is devoid of humans, as always. That's to be expected, seeing as that isn't a place that the living are supposed to go ---- but those sorts of restrictions don't exist in Gensokyo.
But once actually on this road, most will still feel a sense of longing for the world of the living.
With that thought in mind, I hoped to compose a track full of ethereal and nostalgic feeling.
I hope you indeed have this feeling when dodging the danmaku with this atmosphere, lol.
——小闰 }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 3 Boss - Fujiwara no Ayane's Theme |title =探韵夷社的光君 ～ Miscanthus Love lyrics |titleEN =Lord of Light Who Samples Foreign Melodies ~ Miscanthus Love lyrics |composer =SD |comment =藤原 文祢的主题曲。
以带有海鲜堂味的和风为目标，但最终还是依照自己的想法来了…
试着写出一种悲剧的浪漫感，应该多少有几分了吧。
把历史用歌人的风格展现出来，那种感觉，大概。
——SD |translation =Fujiwara no Ayane's Theme.
My goal was Kaisendo-like Japanese style, but in the end I went my own way...
I tried to go for a feeling of tragic romanticism, I think there's some of it there.
The feeling of presenting a singer's style with history. That kind of feeling, I guess.
——SD }} {{MusicRoom |category =Player's Score Theme |title =红雪驻雀的缘歌 ～ Player's Score |titleEN =Karmic Song of Red Snow and Perching Sparrows ~ Player's Score |composer =SD |comment =疮痍界面的主题曲之一。
那，先祝各位疮痍愉快了。
旋律借鉴了3BOSS曲，加入了一些Swing的元素，变得更加闲适……
说起来好久没去过咖啡厅了，改天一定去。
——SD |translation =One of the themes for the game-over screen.
Firstly, congratulations on game-overing.
The melody was borrowed from the Stage 3 boss, with some swing elements, thus becoming more idyllic...
Now that I think of it, it's been a while since I've been to a coffee shop. I'll go soon.
——SD }}
==Notes== {{reflist}}
{{Navbox CUO}} [[Category:Music by Game]] [[Category:Translations]]

revision.comment: 小物 was very poorly translated. It literally means *small thing*, nothing to do with being fussy or petty at all. It's referring to her (Seija) being weak. She's a jobber. A little punk. A weakling.
revision.text:
==Music List== {{MusicRoom | category =Title screen | title =不思議なお祓い棒 | roma =Fushigina oharaibou | titleEN =Mysterious Purification Rod | comment =　タイトル画面のテーマです。 　いつも通りですが、今回アップテンポの曲が多いので
　タイトル画面ではしっとりするように作るつもりでした。 　それはどうかな？ | translation =The title screen theme. [[Theme of Eastern Story|It's the same as usual]], but since there's so many up-tempo tracks this time,
I intended to make the title screen more subdued. I wonder if it worked? }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 theme | title =ミストレイク | roma =Misuto reiku | titleEN =[[Misty Lake|Mist Lake]] | comment =　１面のテーマです。 　１面という事で、ちょっとインパクトのある曲にしました。
　どういう原理で湖に常に霧が立ちこめているんでしょうねぇ。
　魚は棲んで無さそうですが、意外と色んな妖怪が棲んでいる
　みたいです。 | translation =The stage 1 theme. Since it's the stage 1 theme, I made it a track to leave a bit of an impact.
Thanks to some principle or other, there's always mist hanging over the lake.
No fish seem to live there, but there surprisingly seems to be various [[youkai]]
living there. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 Boss - [[Wakasagihime]]'s theme | title =秘境のマーメイド | roma =Hikyou no māmeido | titleEN =Mermaid from the Uncharted Land | comment =　わかさぎ姫のテーマです。 　水中なら腕に自信がある人魚ですが、残念ながら幻想郷は
　陸地の方が多いのです。
　本気さを感じないかるーい感じの戦闘曲にしました。
　天ぷら大好きです。 | translation =Wakasagihime's theme. She's a [[wikipedia:Mermaid|mermaid]] who's confident in her ability while underwater,
but unfortunately there's more land than water in [[Gensokyo]].
I made this battle music with a light feeling to it, rather than a serious one.
I do love tempura. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 theme | title =運河を行き交う人妖 | roma =Unga o yukikau nin'you | titleEN =Humans and Youkai Traversing the Canal | comment =　２面のテーマです。 　一面ののほほん感とはうって変わって中二っぽい
　妖怪なので少し意識しました。 　一定のビートで淡々と進む感じが出ているかなと。 | translation =The stage 2 theme. In sharp contrast to the relaxed feeling of stage 1, the youkai here have a "cooler-
than-thou" {{nihongo|'''Chuuni'''|中二}}, shortened from {{nihongo|'''chuunibyou'''|中二病|eighth-grader syndrome}}: [http://en.dic.pixiv.net/a/Chuunibyou a slang term] that more-or-less means what was said here. thing going on, which I kept in mind somewhat. Does the constant beat give a feeling of indifferent progress? | note =This description is similar in style to the description for [[Perfect Cherry Blossom/Music#Stage 5 Boss - Youmu_Konpaku's theme|Youmu's theme]]. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 Boss - [[Sekibanki]]'s theme | title =柳の下のデュラハン | roma =Yanagi no shita no dyurahan | titleEN =Dullahan Under the Willows | comment =　赤蛮奇のテーマです。 　ろくろ首って、首が伸びるんだか頭が飛ぶんだか
　よく判らないですよね。
　でも首が飛んでいるときに体を動かすと、元に
　戻れなくなるみたいですよ？ | translation =Sekibanki's theme. I don't really know whether [[wikipedia:Rokurokubi|rokurokubi]] are supposed to stretch their neck
or send their head flying.
But when the head comes off and their body moves elsewhere,
it seems like they can't go back to normal, right? | note =In Irish mythology, a [[wikipedia:Dullahan|dullahan]] is a headless horse rider that's always seeking its head. The description hangs onto this question on whether or not it will even ''find'' the head. Curiously, Sekibanki is a combination of both types of mythology: she has her head, but she lets it "loose" even though it isn't connected. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 theme | title =満月の竹林 | roma =Mangetsu no chikurin | titleEN =Bamboo Forest of the Full Moon | comment =　３面のテーマです。 　竹林で満月ですよ。
　いつの間にか迷いの竹林は月を崇める妖怪の聖地に
　なっていたんですね。
　曲も永夜抄のアレを意識しました。 | translation =The stage 3 theme. It's a full moon in the [[Bamboo Forest of the Lost|Bamboo Forest]].
At some point, the Bamboo Forest of the Lost became a sacred place
for youkai who worship the [[moon]].
I kept [[Imperishable Night/Music#Stage 4 theme|''that'']] from ''[[Imperishable Night]]'' in mind for this track, too. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 Boss - [[Kagerou Imaizumi]]'s theme | title =孤独なウェアウルフ | roma =Kodokuna weaurufu | titleEN =Lonesome Werewolf | comment =　今泉 影狼のテーマです。 　中ボスっぽい感じを出しまくってみました。
　まあ三面ですしね。 　ちなみに満月は本物ですので彼女も変身できます。 | translation =Kagerou Imaizumi's theme. I tried giving it a midboss-ish feeling.
Because it's stage 3 and all. By the way, since this full moon is real, she can transform, too. | note =The "full moon being real" is a reference to [[Imperishable Night]]'s main scenario, where the full moon was replaced with an incomplete, illusory one. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4 theme | title =マジカルストーム | roma =Majikaru sutōmu | titleEN =Magical Storm | comment =　４面のテーマです。 　不気味かと言えばそうでも無く、明るいかと言えばそうでも無い。
　ちょっと不思議な浮遊感を出してます。
　嵐の割にはフワフワしているし……。
　文字通り足が地に着かない感じですね。 | translation =The stage 4 theme. It's not quite "eerie", and not quite "bright".
It gives more of a feeling of "mysterious floatiness".
Even though it's a storm, you float around calmly...
It gives a feeling of literally not having your feet on the ground. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4 Boss - [[Benben Tsukumo]]'s and [[Yatsuhashi Tsukumo]]'s theme | title =幻想浄瑠璃 | roma =Gensou joururi | titleEN =Illusionary [[wikipedia:Joruri (music)|Joururi]] | comment =　九十九 弁々　九十九 八橋のテーマです。 　もっとベタな伝統的な和風の曲にしようかとも思ったのですが、
　曲の技巧だけ走ってしまうとゲームの雰囲気が滅茶苦茶になるので
　グッとこらえました。
　でも何とかそれっぽくしたけど琵琶の音源が無くてしょんぼりです。 | translation =Benben Tsukumo's and Yatsuhashi Tsukumo's theme. I had wanted to make it a more clichéd kind of traditional Japanese song,
but if you let the songs be too technical, the atmosphere of the game is ruined.
So I held back.
Though I did make it sort of like that, I didn't have a sample for a biwa, so that left me feeling a bit depressed. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 theme | title =空中に沈む輝針城 | roma =Kuuchuu ni shizumu kishinjou | titleEN =The Shining Needle Castle Sinking in the Air |also= {{DrLFR}} | comment =　５面のテーマです。 　大きな意味も無く、切ない感じの曲にしました。 　切ないメロディだけど軽快なリズム。
　こういう曲が流れると終盤だなーって感じます。 | translation =The stage 5 theme. I made it a song with no real meaning besides feeling sad. It has a sorrowful melody, but a light-hearted rhythm.
I feel like when this sort of song starts playing, you've entered the final part of the game. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 Boss - [[Seija Kijin]]'s theme | title =リバースイデオロギー | roma =Ribāsu ideorogī | titleEN =Reverse Ideology |also= {{DBOA}} | comment =　鬼人 正邪のテーマです。
　極めて小物臭のする妖怪をイメージして曲を作りました。
　結果、何だかやんちゃな曲に……まあボスっぽいノリで楽しいよね。
　他人が嫌がることを率先してやる小物なボスですが、
　それでも今回の黒幕です。
| translation =Seija Kijin's theme.
I wrote this while thinking of the image of a punk youkai.
The result is pretty mischievous... well, the mood's pretty boss-like, so I'm happy.
This is a weak boss that will take the initiative in doing things others dislike.
Even so, she's the villain this round.
}} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 theme | title =針小棒大の天守閣 | roma =Shinshouboudai no tenshukaku | titleEN =The Exaggerated Castle Keep | comment =　６面のテーマです。
　何だか少し焦る感じを出してます。
　ここからラスボス、エンディングと３曲同じメロディにして、
　今作の共通のテーマっぽくしてみました。
| translation =The stage 6 theme.
This song creates a slight feeling of being in a hurry.
Together with the last boss after this and the ending theme, there are 3 songs with the same melody.
Since I tried doing that this time around, it gives them all a sense of togetherness.
}} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 Boss - [[Shinmyoumaru Sukuna]]'s theme | title =輝く針の小人族　～ Little Princess | roma =Kagayaku hari no kobito-zoku | titleEN =Inchlings of the Shining Needle ~ Little Princess | comment =　少名 針妙丸のテーマです。 　小さい身体なりの格好良い曲にしました。
　重厚さは少ないですが、如何にもラスボスっぽい気持ちの良い
　広がり方のする曲になってると思います。
　あれ？　小さくないって？　まあ是非クリアして下さいな。 | translation =Shinmyoumaru Sukuna's theme. I made it a cool song fit for a small body.
It's not very heavy, but I think I gave it a nice expansion
that really makes her feel like a last boss.
Huh? She's not small? Well, then please beat the game. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage theme | title =魔力の雷雲 | roma =Maryoku no raiun | titleEN =Thunderclouds of Magical Power | comment =　エキストラステージのテーマです。 　抵抗なくさらっと流れる感じの王道の道中曲です。 　実はあちこちに東方らしいエッセンスを散りばめてます。
　それに深い意味はありません。 | translation =The extra stage theme. This is the song for smoothly advancing down the royal road without resistance. Actually, a very Touhou-ish "essence" is scattered here and there.
There's no deep meaning to it. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage Boss - [[Raiko Horikawa]]'s theme | title =始原のビート　～ Pristine Beat | roma =Shigen no bīto | titleEN =Primordial Beat ~ Pristine Beat | comment =　堀川 雷鼓のテーマです。 　ドラムメイン曲にしようかと思ってたのですが、流石に
　その勇気は無かったです。ゲームのイメージ的に。
　間奏はちょっとだけドラムが主役になります。
　ちなみに靴の構造上、足をじたばたさせてバスドラムを
　叩くんでしょうね。 | translation =Raiko Horikawa's theme. I wanted to make the song feature drums prominently, but
in the end I just didn't have the courage. In terms of the game's image.
The drums play a main part for a short interlude section of the song.
As a side note, her shoes are probably made so she can swing her feet
to hit the bass drum. | note =*The words "pristine" or "{{lang|ja|始原}} enphasizes a long history of Raiko or of the drum. But the naming of the music seems to be just a pun — the words have very similar meaning to "ancient/very-old", and there is a Japanese word {{nihongo|"ancient"|太古|taiko}}, which shares the same sound with {{nihongo|"drum"|太鼓|taiko}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Ending theme | title =小槌の魔力 | roma =Kozuchi no maryoku | titleEN =Magical Power of the Mallet | comment =　エンディングのテーマです。 　終盤はラスボスのテーマで纏めてみました。 　それぞれ違ったイメージになるんじゃないでしょうか？ | translation =The ending theme. I tried adding in parts of the last boss theme to the end. Doesn't that leave different impressions for each? }} {{MusicRoom | category =Staff Roll theme | title =不思議な不思議な道具達 | roma =Fushigina fushigina dougutachi | titleEN =Mysterious, Mysterious Tools | comment =　スタッフロールのテーマです。 　タイトルの曲のバージョン違いです。
　正直最初から、どっちかっていうとタイトルじゃなくて
　エンディング寄りの曲だと思ってました。
　よく見るとスタッフの表示と曲のタイミングがぴったりですよ。 | translation =The staff roll theme.
A different version of the title song.
To be honest, I was thinking it wouldn't be
the title, but a song for the ending.
If you look closely, the credits and the song are timed perfectly. }} ==Notes== {{smallrefs}} {{Project Translations Notice}} {{Navbox DDC}} [[Category:Music by Game]] [[Category:Translations]] [[pl:Double Dealing Character/Muzyka]] [[ru:Double Dealing Character/Музыка]]

==Music List== {{MusicRoom | category =Title and Menu Theme | title =ニュースハウンド | roma =nyūsu haundo | titleEN =Newshound | comment =　タイトル画面のテーマです。

　いつも通りの曲ですが、いつでも出撃可能状態といった感じを
　入れました。
　いつものゲームよりメニュー画面になってる率が高いしねー。 | translation =This is the theme of the title screen.

It's [[Theme of Eastern Story|the usual music]], but I added in a sensation that one could make a sortie at any moment.
Chances are a lot better for you to see the menu screen than in the usual games, it is. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Photo Theme 1 | title =あなたの町の怪事件 | roma =anata no machi no kaijiken | titleEN =The Mystery in Your Town | comment =　取材のテーマ１です。
　まだ取材が穏やかだった頃のテーマです。意気揚々として元気な
　感じを出しました。
　一応、初心者向けステージのテーマとなります。
　１ステージクリアする時間より曲の方が長いので、上手い人なら
　前奏だけで終わってしまうかもね。 | translation =The first event coverage theme.
This theme is for when the event coverage was still quiet. It produces a spirited, triumphant feel.
I would say, it's the theme for the beginners' stage.
The music lasts longer than it takes to clear the stage, so skilled players might only hear the overture before they're done. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Photo Theme 2 | title =妖怪モダンコロニー | roma =youkai modan koronī | titleEN =Youkai Modern Colony | comment =　取材のテーマ２です。
　ここから妖怪の質も変化し中級編に入ります。
　古典的な妖怪が多めの中級編。威厳を失った妖怪達が幻想郷の影で
　楽しく暮らす様は、まるで妖怪のスペースコロニーのようです。
　そんな妖怪達をガシガシ取材して、表舞台に立たせてあげましょう。
　まだまだ余裕、余裕。 | translation =The second event coverage theme.
From here on, we enter the intermediate stage and the quality of youkai changes.
The intermediate stage with many classical youkai. The youkai who lost their dignity living happily in the shadow of Gensokyo seems just like a ''youkai space colony''.
Let's do the coverage on such youkai with gusto and put them up on center stage.
Plenty of room yet, plenty of room. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Photo Theme 3 | title =ネメシスの要塞 | roma =nemeshisu no yousai | titleEN =Nemesis' Stronghold | comment =　取材のテーマ３です。
　さあさあ上級編です。この辺から撮影枚数三桁はザラですよねー。
　手強そうな取材相手に立ち向かう姿をイメージして書きました。
　ちょっと男前そうなメロディですか、音やリズムでほんのりと
　可愛い感じが出てるかと思います。
　いやあ、上級は手強いぜ。 | translation =The third event coverage theme.
Okay, now we're into the advanced levels. From here on, shot counts in the hundreds is common, right?
I wrote this with the image of you facing your tough news coverage opponent in mind.
The melody is a bit manly handsome, but I'm pretty confident that I made the sounds and rhythm produce a slightly cute feel.
Wow, the advanced levels are tough! }} {{MusicRoom | category =Photo Theme 4 | title =無間の鐘　～ {{lang|en|Infinite Nightmare}} | roma =muken no kane | titleEN =Bell of Avici ~ Infinite Nightmare | comment =　取材のテーマ４です。
　その鐘を鳴らすと現世では幸せを得られるが、来世は絶え間なく苦
　が続く最悪の地獄、無間（むけん）無間 (Muken: Without waves or Non-stop) and 無限 (Mugen: Infinity or Endless) are different words with different concept.地獄におちるという無間の鐘。
　恐らく多くの人が、最も長時間聞くはめになる曲ですのでメリハリ
　を抑えて疲れにくい感じにしました。
　まさに無間地獄。フハハハ、精々頑張るんだな！ | translation =The fourth event coverage theme.
It is said that when one rings Bell of [[Wikipedia:Avici|Avici]] (''Muken Jigoku''), it will bring one happiness in this life, but will drop one into the Avici, the worst level of Hell, where suffering continues unabated, in the afterlife.
This was likely the song people would be stuck hearing for the longest time, so I decided to restrain the liveliness, making it harder to get tired of it.
This truly is a non-stop hell. Muhahaha, you'll endure it as best you can! }} {{MusicRoom | category =Photo Theme 5 | title =妖怪の山　～ {{lang|en|Mysterious Mountain}} | roma =youkai no yama | titleEN =Youkai Mountain ~ Mysterious Mountain |comment =　取材のテーマ５です。
　天狗同士の醜い争いのテーマです。
　って、実は二人は仲が悪いわけではなく、ただ単に修行しあって
　撮影技術の向上に努めているだけなんですよね。
　一応、最終レベルですが難易度は決して高くないので、ここまで
　来た方には楽勝でしょう。 | translation =The fifth event coverage theme.
This is the theme of the unsightly dispute between tengu.
Well, actually, this doesn't mean that they have bad relations with each other - it's simply their training, working hard to elevate their photographic skills.
I would say, this is the final level, but its difficulty level isn't that high, so this should be an easy win for anyone who's come this far. | note=This is a revised version of the song of the same name in [[Mountain of Faith/Music|Mountain of Faith]]. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Congratulation Screen | titleEN =??? | note =This is an additional theme which is not listed in the music room. It is played on the Congratulation screen when Hatate is unlocked or given the Tengu Master Title. It's a variation of the title screen theme. You can access this song freely by using one of the various [[Game Tools and Modifications#Music-Related Utilities|music tools]]. }} == Also See == * [[List_by_Song/Double Spoiler|Double Spoiler arrangements listed by song]] == References == {{Project Translations Notice}} {{Navbox DS}} [[de:Double Spoiler/Musik]] [[ru:Double Spoiler/Музыка]] [[zh:对抗新闻/音乐]] [[Category:Double Spoiler]] [[Category:Music by Game]]

==Music List== {{MusicRoom | category =Title theme | title =迷った季節の奇想天外な論理 | roma =Mayotta kisetsu no kisōtengai na ronri | titleEN =The Fantastic Logic of the Lost Season | composer =VYCM | comment =タイトル画面のテーマです。 これからの旅を象徴する曲のつもりで作りました。
ドンドンと進むテクノ音で現実の不安性と今後の展開をメインに置きながら、
ストーリーの心情的な要素をほのめかすメロディや楽器も入りました。 | translation =The title screen theme. A piece that I wanted to encapsulate the journey ahead. I went with a driving techno beat to emphasize that reality is shifting and things are really about to happen, but also included some melodies and instruments that hint at the more emotional aspects of the story. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 theme | title =夢論理世界の醒覚 | roma =Muronri sekai no seikaku | titleEN =Awakening of the Dream-logical World | composer =VYCM | comment =１面のテーマです。 「冒険の始まり！ 早く行こう！」と言っているようなアップテンポに加えて、
ダイヤを生える森という奇妙な美しさを表現したかった曲。
世界の何がずれてしまったのか、その詳細に触れるのはもう少し後のこと。 夢の世界だという一番の証拠は、普通の世界じゃこんなに速くピアノを弾けないことだろうね。 | translation =The stage 1 theme. This theme is meant to capture the surreal beauty of the diamond tree grove, with a fast-paced beat that screams "Let's go! It's the start of the adventure!" We haven't yet delved very far into what's gone wrong with the world. That comes later. You know it's a dream-logical world because in a normal world no one could actually play the piano that fast. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 Boss - [[Dream Logical World/Characters#Nunokae Yukimura|Nunokae Yukimura]]'s theme | title =Discernment ～ 試される純心 | roma =Tamesareru junshin | titleEN =Discernment ~ Trial of the Pure Heart | composer =VYCM | comment =雪村布返のテーマです。 アップテンポな道中曲の後に、ボスの方をスローペースにしたら
気が緩んでしまうかと思ったのでこうしました。
テンポ自体は速いが、優しさを求めるキャラに相応しく、柔らかくて繊細な感じにしました。 因みに、布返は『鶴の恩返し』に登場する鶴と共通点を持ちながらも同じ人物ではありません。 | translation =Nunokae Yukimura's theme. After the fast-paced introduction the stage 1 theme gives you, I thought it'd be sort of a letdown if the first boss's theme wasn't similarly upbeat, so this came out. Despite the similar tempo, it's more mellow and delicate to fit a character who seeks out kindness. Incidentally, while Nunokae has some things in common with the crane featured in "Tsuru no Ongaeshi", she isn't the same one. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 theme | title =晩秋のT．N．G． | roma =Banshuu no tī-en-jī | titleEN =T.N.G. of Autumn | composer =VYCM | comment =２面のテーマです。 ステージの設定や会話と同じように、静かでメランコリックだが少し緊張した雰囲気の曲。
T．N．G．は「The Neutral Girl （中立の少女）」の略です。
略があるとミニマリズムとかミステリアスな感じになるだろう？ 開発中のインスピレーションとして、昔は無理だと思ったＥＸを含めて原作の全通しプレイをしました。
そして「突然現れる弾」という旧作シリーズの特徴を入れば、鉄子の孤独な性格も表現できる！
……と思い上がったところで、実は妖々夢のＥＸにもあったという事実を初めて知った。
（それでも私の気に入りポイントです） | translation =The stage 2 theme. A piece that compliments the stage's story by being calm and melancholy, but a little tense. T.N.G. stands for "The Neutral Girl". The abbreviation makes it all minimalistic and mysterious and stuff. To get some inspiration while working on this game, I played through all the official Touhou games again, including the Extra stages, which I'd previously considered above my pay grade. Here I was thinking I'd cleverly illustrated Tetsuko's lonesome personality by reintroducing the PC-98-style bullets from nowhere, only to find out they've been in Perfect Cherry Blossom this whole time. Oh well, I still like it. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 Boss - [[Dream Logical World/Characters#Tetsuko Yorubana|Tetsuko Yorubana]]'s theme | title =そよ風に吹かれる栄樹 | roma =Soyokaze ni fukareru eishu | titleEN =[[wikipedia:Erica arborea|Erica Arborea]] in the BreezeIn the Japanese [[wikipedia:Hanakotoba|language of flowers]], [[wikipedia:Erica (plant)|Erica]] is sometimes ascribed the meaning of "solitude", fitting Tetsuko's status as a recluse. | composer =VYCM | comment =夜花鉄子のテーマです。 陰気で切なく、でもボス曲に相応しく迫力のある曲を作るのは面白い挑戦でした。
初期の案として超変則な拍子にしようと思いましたが、うまく作れなくて没にした。
その後の案も明るすぎて没。 ようやくこの案に落ち着いて、かなり満足しました。 ドレスの技や葉が枯れ落ちると、新しいのをつけるかな？ | translation =Tetsuko Yorubana's theme. Composing something melancholy and wistful, but with enough drive to fit as a boss theme, was an interesting challenge I hadn't quite tried before. My first idea was to do something with a really unconventional time signature, but I couldn't get it to sound right. My second attempt came out way too lighthearted. Finally I came up with this, and I'm quite satisfied with it. I wonder if she attaches new twigs and leaves to her dress when they decay and crumble? }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 theme | title =画定された存在 ～ Material Fear | roma =Kakutei sareta sonzai | titleEN =Delineated Existence ~ Material Fear | composer =VYCM | comment =３面のテーマです。 鉄子戦の不思議さと落ち着いた雰囲気から打って変わって、危険な場所に入ったのを告げるように
ダークなテクノ感を強調しました。 狂った悪のメリーゴーランドのような感じだと思います、特に中盤が。
どうかプレイヤーのテンションが上がるように！ あとここだけの話ですが、主なコード進行はニッキー・ミナージュの『Hey Mama』から取ったものだったりして。 | translation =The stage 3 theme. Doing a 180 from the mellow and mysterious encounter with Tetsuko, I cranked up the dark techno to let you know the world has become a dangerous place. I think the middle section in particular sounds like a crazy, evil merry-go-round. I hope it gets your adrenaline pumped up. Also, don't tell anyone, but I stole the main section's chord progression from Nicki Minaj's "Hey Mama". }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 Boss - [[Dream Logical World/Characters#Acytota|Acytota]]'s theme | title =アンデッド・マレヴォレンス | roma =Andeddo marevorensu | titleEN =Undead Malevolence | composer =VYCM | comment =エイサイトアのテーマです。 割と変な曲だけど、自分を複製するために生き物の細胞を乗っ取る生物学的粒子という概念から
生まれた意識を持つ超常現象的な化物……なんてものを表現するには変な雰囲気が一番だろう？
彼女がキャラと作戦を突然切り替わるように、この曲も打楽器が強いところと打楽器のないところ、
妖しげなバイオリンと悪戯っぽいシロホンを常に切り替わっている。 | translation =Acytota's theme. It's kind of a weird song, but the theme song of a sentient supernatural creature created from the idea of a biological particle that commandeers living cells to create multiples of itself probably should be weird. Just like Acytota switches her demeanor and tactics on a dime, her theme switches back and forth between heavy percussion and absent percussion, eerie violin and mischievous xylophone. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4 theme | title =夢想的誤謬 | roma =Musou-teki gobyuu | titleEN =Oneiric Fallacy | composer =VYCM | comment =4面のテーマです。

ストーリー上でターニングポイントとなる、奇妙で夢のような森です。ステージが短いので曲も短めです。
テーマ・オブ・イースタンストーリーはステージのネタバレになるのでやめました。 | translation =The stage 4 theme. A weird, dreamlike forest that serves as the turning point in the game's story. It's a fairly short song to fit a short stage portion.
I didn't add Theme of Eastern Story because that would give it away. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4A Bosses - Reimu and Kasen's Theme | title =永遠の華狭間 | roma =Eien no hanahazama | titleEN =Eternal Flower Threshold | composer =VYCM | comment =霊夢と華扇のテーマ、「永遠の巫女」と「華狭間のバトルフィールド」のマッシュアップです。

永遠の巫女、特に『東方幻想的音楽』版は東方全体を通しても私の一番のお気に入りだったので、霊夢のテーマも当然これになりました。

永遠の華狭間を含め、4面のボス戦曲は片方の曲が出しゃぱっているように感じるかもしれませんが、華狭間のバトルフィールドが目立つ部分もあります。例えば最初の方と最後の方のチェロの低音とか。 | translation =Reimu and Kasen's theme.
A mash-up of "Eternal Shrine Maiden" and "Battlefield of the Flower Threshold".

Eternal Shrine Maiden, specifically the MIDI arrangement from ZUN's website, is one of my all-time favorite Touhou songs, so of course that's what I went for when choosing which of Reimu's themes to include. You might feel that there's a dominant theme in some of the stage 4 boss tracks, including this one, but Flower Threshold does shine in a few places. Listen to the cello playing the low notes near the beginning and at the end. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4B Bosses - Marisa and Yuuka's Theme | title =幽夢 〜 Dimensional Dream | roma =Yuumu | titleEN =Faint Dream ~ Dimensional Dream | composer =VYCM | comment =魔理沙と幽香のテーマ、「Dim. Dream」と「幽夢 ~ Inanimate Dream」のマッシュアップです。

2曲合わせて3回「夢」を表す単語が出てきます。これほどうってつけな組み合わせは他にないでしょう。

旧作の曲のアレンジはいつも楽しいものです。Dim. Dreamは割と単純だったので、音を増やしてかさ増ししています。
本当なら「東方封魔再録でもこういう事はたくさんありました」と言いたい所なのですが、東方封魔再録の正体とは僕達が旅の中で出会った仲間のことだったのです。なんつって。 | translation =Marisa and Yuuka's theme.
A mash-up of "Dimensional Dream" and "Faint Dream ~ Inanimate Dream".

Three instances of the word "dream" across two song titles. There wasn't a more fitting pair.

Doing arrangements of songs from the PC-98 era is something I always find interesting. Dim.Dream is a pretty simple song, so I tried fleshing it out with some additional voices. This is where I was supposed to say "As you may have heard for yourself, I did the same thing with plenty of tracks in Return of Eastern Wonderland", but it turns out the real RoEW was the friends we made along the way. Oops. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4C Bosses - Sakuya and Reisen's Theme | title =月時計 〜 Invisible Full Moon | roma =Tsukidokei | titleEN =Lunar Clock ~ Invisible Full Moon | composer =VYCM | comment =咲夜と鈴仙のテーマ、「月時計 ~ ルナ・ダイアル」と「狂気の瞳 ~ Invisible Full Moon」のマッシュアップです。

咲夜のテーマといえばフラワリングナイトの方が人気で、一度はそっちにすることも検討したのですが、ルナ・ダイアルの方が曲的にもタイトル的にもうまく順み合いました。
4面ボスは曲だけでなく、弾幕のスタイルも組み合わさっていますが、単に原作から組み合わせるだけでなく、各チームに個性を持たせることも意識しました。ギミック性の強いこの二人では顕著だと思います。 | translation =Sakuya and Reisen's theme.
A mash-up of "Lunar Clock ~ Luna Dial" and "Lunatic Eyes ~ Invisible Full Moon".

Flowering Night seems to be Sakuya's most popular theme, and I considered using that one, but Lunar Clock fit better in terms of both composition and title.

As well as combining the stage 4 bosses' theme songs, I also merged elements from their danmaku styles. But I also wanted to give each team a unique identity for this game beyond just combining their pattern styles from the official games. I think all of this shows pretty well in a fight with two characters whose official patterns are fairly gimmicky. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4D Bosses - Sanae and Seija's Theme | title =信仰は確かな人間の為に | roma =Shinkou wa tashika na ningen no tame ni | titleEN =Faith is for the Permanent People | composer =VYCM | comment =早苗と正邪のテーマ、「信仰は夢き人間の為に」と「リバースイデオロギー」のマッシュアップです。

全然違う二人の全然違う二曲ですが、なんとか組み合わさりました。友達は「憂鬱感があるね」って言っていました。
もしかしたらお互い違う目的で行動してるが故の混乱とか、夢論理を解明しようとする二人の焦りとか、 そういうふかーいイメージなのかも? あー、そーそー、そういうのがやりたかったんだよねー () | translation =Sanae and Seija's theme.
A mash-up of "Faith is For the Transient People" and "Reverse Ideology".

Two rather different songs for two very different characters. I mashed them up, though, somehow. My friend said he thought this song sounded sort of melancholy. Maybe that can represent each character's different motivations for solving the incident and their confusion, or maybe frustration, at trying to see through the dream logic?
…Yeah, that's it. That's definitely the deep symbolic allegory I planned from the start. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4E Bosses - Youmu and Koishi's Theme | title =ハルトマンの妖怪少女射怪鳥事 | roma =Harutoman no youkai shoujo kechou o iru koto | titleEN =Hartmann's Youkai Girl Shoots a Strange Bird | composer =VYCM | comment =妖夢とこいしのテーマ、「広有射怪鳥事 ~ Till When?」と「ハルトマンの妖怪少女」のマッシュアップです。

もし『東方海恵堂』で始まって『Marine Benefit』で終わるタイトルのゲームをプレイしたことがあるならギミックの正体はすぐに気づくかもしれません。
各自機組にはチーム名を表すシンボルがあり、妖夢とこいしの場合はベン図です。論理的分類、ON/OFFする弾幕というのはとても論理的に思えました。この曲もそれに合ったパズル感が出ていれば幸いです。 | translation =Youmu and Koishi's theme.
A mash-up of "Hiroari Shoots a Strange Bird ~ Till When?" and "Hartmann's Youkai Girl". I'm sure you'll instantly recognize the main gimmick of the battle if you've played a game that begins with "{{lang|ja|東方海恵堂}}" and ends with "[[Marine Benefit]]".
All the playable teams have a symbol representing their team name, in this case a Venn diagram. Logical categories, bullets that switch on and off…it seemed logical to me.
I wanted their theme to have sort of a puzzley sound to fit the idea as well. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4F Bosses - Aya and Kosuzu's Theme | title =判読眼の少女達 | roma =Handokume no shoujo-tachi | titleEN =Girls with Deciphering Eyes | composer =VYCM | comment =文と小鈴のテーマ、「風神少女」と「判読眼のビプロフィリア」のマッシュアップです。

小鈴参戦！ 東方実在相の原案と自機キャラクターの大半は弾幕アマノジャクと東方深秘録の間の時期に考え付いたものです。
その間華扇と小鈴のテーマはずっと自分で作らないといけないのか、あるいは他のファンの曲を使わせてもらうか悩んでいたのですが、それから実際に作り始めるまでの間に正式なテーマが出てほっとしました。 | translation =Aya and Kosuzu's theme.
A mash-up of "Wind God Girl" and "Bibliophile with a Deciphering Eye".

Kosuzu's in a game! I came up with the concept for DLW and decided on most of the playable characters between the releases of Impossible Spell Card and Urban Legend in Limbo.
For a while there, I was wondering if I'd have to compose my own themes or use fan-made themes as a base for Kasen and Kosuzu. But it just so happened that between then and the moment I
actually started working on the stage 4 boss pieces, both of them got their own official themes! }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 theme | title =相の樹の上の剪定ノコギリ | roma =Sou no ki no ue no sentei nokogiri | titleEN =A Pruning Saw on the Tree of Aspects | composer =VYCM | comment =5面のテーマです。

実在相の曲は基本的に作中に登場する順番に作曲したのですが、この曲だけは例外で、一番最初に作曲したものです。現実のさまざまな実相や要素を表したとてつもない大樹のイメージがあって、これは絶対5面だと確信しながら、
その樹のイメージから曲を書き上げました。幾重にも枝分かれする現実の実相を僕なりに表現するために、この曲は短いフレーズのバリエーションからなっていて、同じメロディが違う速さで同時に流れることもあります。 | translation =The stage 5 theme.

I composed the songs in pretty much the order they appear, but this is an exception because it's the first thing I ever made for the game.
I got an image in my head of a surreal, impossibly large tree representing the aspects of existence, which I knew would be the setting of stage 5, and tried to write a song that captured the feeling it gave me.
It's based on variations of a short phrase, and there are a few parts where the same melody is played at different speeds at the same time, my way of representing the branching, fractal-like aspects of existence. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 boss - Kiseki Amashirasagi's theme | title =世界の実相の思想 〜 Stream of Consciousness | roma =Sekai no jissou no shisou | titleEN =Thoughts of the Aspects of Existence ~ Stream of Consciousness | composer =VYCM | comment =天白鷲勢世樹のテーマです。

ボス曲を書く時、キャラ自身の性質とボス戦の際の状況を両方考慮に入れています。幻想郷の皆は見たこともない異質な敵を相手にしているので、不安で張り詰めた空気感です。
構造的に言えば「意識の流れ」、特にラスボスの意識の流れの音楽的表現です。不安定な拍子や伝説のマイクロトーンも含め、試したことのない要素をいくつも使ってみました。
しかし後者の力はむやみに扱うと危険なので、耳を澄まして聴かないと気づきにくいかもしれません。 | translation =Kiseki Amashirasagi's theme.

When writing boss music, I try to consider both the attributes of the boss themself and the context in which the battle takes place. The mood is tense and uncertain because the girls of Gensokyo are facing an unusual enemy they haven't quite seen the likes of before. In terms of structure, it's a musical representation of a stream of consciousness. Specifically, that of the final boss. I pulled out several stops I'd never tried before for this one, including unstable time signatures and even the legendary microtones.

You might not notice the latter until you've listened carefully, though, because that kind of power can be dangerous if wielded irresponsibly. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 theme | title =整え育て、待ちて願う | roma =Totonoe sodate, machite negau | titleEN =Pruning and Growing, Waiting and Hoping | composer =VYCM | comment =6面のテーマです。

ラスポス曲の一部を6面道中曲に入れるのはかっこいいと前から思ってましたし、時系列上では実在相はその始まりとなる本家作品である輝針城と紺珠伝の間にあるので、こうするしか他がありませんね。
至んだ音声はSophietta氏が録音してくださったものです。愛美のセリフの一部(訳注:初期の翻訳版)を読み上げています。 | translation =The stage 6 theme.

Including a segment of the final boss's theme in the directly-preceding stage theme always felt cool to me, and since this game takes place chronologically between Double Dealing Character and Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom-the first two official games to do that-it was an obvious choice. Sophietta provided the distorted voices you hear. They're reciting some specific quotes from Aimi. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 boss - Aimi Tourouzaka's theme | title =東方愛美相 〜 Existential Humankind | roma =Touhou aimisou | titleEN =Eastern Aspects of Love and Beauty ~ Existential Humankind | composer =VYCM | comment =灯籍坂愛美のテーマです。

これもキャラクターとシチュエーションの両方を意識した曲です。愛美のバックストーリーや動機に相応しい感動的な、そして幻想郷の運命を分けるクライマックスに相応しい壮大でドラマチックな雰囲気を目指しました。

普段なら曲を1つずつ作曲して、完全に仕上げてから次に移りますが、この曲だけは初期の頃に作り始めて、いくつかの修正をしながら開発期間全体に渡って少しずつ仕上げていったものです。
考えすぎになりがちな自分にとって、しっかり心を込めて作っていくのにはこうするのが一番だったんでしょう。 | translation =Aimi Tourouzaka's theme.

Another song where both the character and the situation come into play. I wanted it to be fittingly emotional for Aimi's backstory and motivation, and also grand and epic to suit the climactic battle for the fate of Gensokyo. I typically finish one song before starting the next, but this theme was started early on and gradually pieced together over the course of development, with several revisions along the way. I tend to overthink things, so this was probably the best way to put a lot of care and effort into it. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 boss - Aimi Tourouzaka's Last Spell theme | title =レクラメイション・オブ・イースタンストーリー | roma =Rekurameishon obu īsutan sutōrī | titleEN =Reclamation of Eastern Story | composer =VYCM | comment =灯籍坂愛美のラスト スペルのテーマです。

一方に主人公達を表すテーマ・オブ・イースタンストーリー。もう一方には愛美のテーマ。
ラストスペルは最近の東方風STGでは頻出なので予想していた方も多いでしょうが、4面ボスが自機である事と同じく、とにかく東方実在相はラストスペルをやるにはうってつけだと思いました。

ちなみに、愛美の名前、デザイン、弾幕スタイルそしてバックストーリーは2015年におおむね出来上がっていました。
名前の読みが同じ某鳥の手品師、幾何学的図形で攻撃する某6面ボス、現実をねじ曲げて皆の性格を変えて自分の事を好きになるようにさせた某緑眼茶髪の事を思い出した方がいるかもしれないので、念のため。 | translation =Aimi Tourouzaka's final spell theme.

In one corner, Theme of Eastern Story, representing the protagonists. In the other, Aimi's theme.
TLBs have been common in recent fangames, so you might've been expecting it at this point, but like the stage 4 playable-character boss fights, I felt this was just a perfect game to do it in.

By the way, Aimi's name, design, danmaku style, and story were mostly-finalized in 2015. Just in case you were thinking of [[Glory of Deep Skies/Characters#Aimi_Sagigamori|a certain avian magician also named Aimi]]. Or [[Keiki Haniyasushin|a certain other final boss who also uses geometric shapes]]. Or [https://doki-doki-literature-club.fandom.com/wiki/Monika_(DDLC) a certain other brown-haired, green-eyed girl who also bends reality and changes people's personalities to make someone fall in love with her and escape a confined life]. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Ending theme | title =白中夢からの目覚め | roma =Hakuchuumu kara no mezame | titleEN =Waking Up from a Waking Dream | composer =VYCM | comment =エンディングのテーマです。

長いエンディングに合わせて曲も長めです。本編同様、エンディングの出来事も内容を頼りに時系列順に並べることができます。
ですが、別に必須という訳ではありません。Extraの解放にも必要ありません。 | translation =The ending theme.

An appropriately long song for a set of lengthy endings.
Just like the main game, you can put the events of the endings in chronological order by following context clues.
I mean, if you want. [[White Names Spoiled Past|You don't need to do that to unlock the Extra stage or anything.]] }} {{MusicRoom | category =Staff Roll theme | title =夢見る季節の昔懐かしい終わり | roma =Yumemiru kisetsu no mukashi natsukashii owari | titleEN =The Nostalgic Ending of the Dream Season | composer =VYCM | comment =スタッフロールのテーマです。

タイトル曲は最初期に書いた曲なので、最後期に書いた曲としてアレンジした時はものすごく懐かしい気分になりました。
スタッフロールの流れと同時に元に戻っていく幻想郷の背景を見ると、貴方もそういう"戻りながら前に進んでいる"気持ちになるかもしれません。 | translation =The staffroll theme.

The title theme was one of the first songs I made for the game, so it was super-nostalgic rearranging it for one of the last songs I made.
Maybe you'll feel a similar going-back-yet-also-going-forward feeling while you watch Gensokyo's landscape transform back to normal as the credits roll. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra stage theme | title =加速する形而上の冬 | roma =Kasoku suru keijijou no fuyu | titleEN =Accelerated Metaphysical Winter | composer =VYCM | comment =エキストラステージのテーマです。

人生の新しい段階に入り、近い未来のことを不安に思いつつつも、次々と来る今後の変化を楽しみにする。そういう気持ちを表現することを目指しました。
年を取っていくとそういう気持ちはだんだん感じなくなるかもしれませんが、それでも変化は訪れます。いつでも、小さな行動で、自分の力で何らかの変化を招くことができると思っています。
新しい趣味を拾ったり、行ったことない場所に行ってみたり、新しい本やゲームでも楽しもうとしたり。そうすれば、新しい考えや思いが生まれます。ちょうど、今の愛美の頭の中と同じように。
『ラストリモート』を初めて聴いた時もそういった人生の変わり目でした。あの曲から、この曲へのインスピレーションも沢山買いました。 | translation =The Extra stage theme.

Moving into a new phase of life, uncertain of what the near future will bring, but knowing that things will change quickly and looking forward to seeing it unfold.
That's the feeling I tried to capture. It's a feeling you might not experience as often as you get older, but change is inevitable. And I think there's almost always something you can do to make it happen, even if it's small.
Picking up a new interest, going somewhere you've never gone before, reading a new book or playing a new game. These are all things that can get new thoughts flowing. Just like the new ones flowing through Aimi.
I first listened to Last Remote during one of those times. That song provided a lot of inspiration here. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage boss - Miyu Aokusa's theme | title =彩り豊かな愛のキャンバス 〜 Romantic Apricity | roma =Irodori yutaka na ai no kyanbasu | titleEN =Colorful Canvas of Love ~ Romantic Apricity | composer =VYCM | comment =青草実タのテーマです。

愛美はストーリー上で一番重要な人物ですが、作品名に名前の一文字がついているのは実夕の方です。もしかして彼女の方が陸斗に相応しい恋人だったからとか・・・・そうじゃないとか。貴方のご想像にお任せします。
ですが、愛美に関してお話できる裏設定があります。以前の宗教戦争の時、彼女は幻想郷の英雄がぶつかり合う姿を見る機会に大喜びして、実際に人間の里や命蓮寺での闘いを目にしました。
もし当時の騒ぎの記録を手に入れることができたら、実在相のエキストラステージで着ている服装から彼女を見つけることができるかもしれません。 | translation =Miyu Aokusa's theme.

Even though Aimi is the most important character in the story, Miyu is the one who gets to share a kanji in her name with the game's title.
Maybe that's because in the end, Miyu really was the true partner for Rikuto. Or maybe not. It's all up to your interpretation.
I'll say something else about Aimi, though. During the religious war a while back, Aimi was thrilled at the chance to watch Gensokyo's heroes duke it out, and she witnessed their battles at the Human Village and Myouren Temple.
If you can somehow get ahold of a record of those events, maybe you can recognize her from the outfit she's wearing in this game's extra stage. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Player's Score theme | title =擬似醒覚 | roma =Giji seikaku | titleEN =False Awakening | composer =VYCM | comment =ゲームオーバーのテーマです。 いつものゲームオーバーの曲に夢論理っぽいテイストを加えたものです。
何度でもやってください！ 練習し続ければ、どんなに深い夢論理でもきっと見破れるよ。 | translation =The Game Over theme. The usual game over song, with an added dream-logical touch. Try and try again. With enough practice, you’ll be able to see through even the thickest dream logic. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Last Word theme | title =ユーフォリックダンマクフェスティバル | roma =Yūforikku danmaku fesutibaru | titleEN =Euphoric Danmaku Festival | composer =VYCM | comment =ラストワードのテーマです。

派手な変化球弾幕がこんなに多いゲームだと、ラストワードはどうするべきか。
それは初論、更に派手な超変化球にするに決まっています。まあ、一部だけですが。普通の直球弾幕もいくつかありますが、それでも楽しんでいただければと思います。 | translation =The Last Word theme.

What do we do with Last Words in a game filled with gimmicky and outlandish patterns? Why, make them even more gimmicky and outlandish, of course. Some of them, anyway. There are a few more normal ones. I hope you enjoy them all the same. }} {{clear}} {{Navbox DLW}} [[Category:Music by Game]]

==Music Room== {{TranslateTable/Header}} {{TranslateTable|h1 | ja =前言 | en =Foreword<ref>Shown when first entering the Music Room, before selecting a track.</ref> }} {{TranslateTable | ja =大家好~我是百灵猫neko，是《东方祈华梦》的曲师。
在这部游戏中，提供了许多东方原作风格的曲子~
如果喜欢，请访问我的网易云或者B站主页支持一下噢！ | en =Hi everyone~I am 百灵猫neko, the composer for Touhou Elegant Impermanence of Sakura.
In this game, I've provided many tracks in the style of the original Touhou works.
If you like them, please support me at my [https://music.163.com/#/artist/album?id=1216015 Netease] and [https://space.bilibili.com/13508532/ Bilibili] pages! }} {{TranslateTable/Footer}}
{{TranslateTable/Header}} {{TranslateTable|h1 | ja =里音乐说明 | en =Hidden Music Comments (Omake.txt) }} {{TranslateTable | ja =这里要写的不是什么结界的咒语，是我在作曲和编曲过程中的一些心得体会
当然，这些音乐也只不过是偶然调和出的而已，没有什么意义 | en =The comments here aren't any border spells, but things I felt while composing.
Of course, I just got these to sound good by chance, there's no real meaning to them. }} {{TranslateTable/Footer}}
{{MusicRoom |category =Title screen |title =意祈华思 夜星明梦 |titleEN =Praying for Flowers, Night-Star Illuminated Dreams |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =标题画面的主题曲。
所谓祈华梦，自然就是祈求荣华的黄粱梦。
请怀抱着这样的感情去进行游戏吧。 |translation =The Title Theme.
So called praying-for-flowers, obviously means the dream of "praying for glory<ref>The word "glory" (荣华) includes the formal character for "flower" (华)</ref>".
Please play the game with this feeling in mind. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =应该不难听出有《飞舞飘散凭依华吹雪》的感觉
因为我很喜欢zun号突然吹响的感觉，于是就模仿了这样一首。 |translation1 =It shouldn't be hard to hear the feeling of ''Blizzard of Scattering Possession Flowers''.
Because I really like the feeling of ZUNpets suddenly ringing out, I imitated that in this track. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 1 Theme |title =幽竹远梦 |titleEN =Distant Dream of Ghostly Bamboo |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =第一面的主题曲，主题是「重逢」和「未来」。
和老朋友一起，少女们又开始了新的旅途，就是那样的感觉。
作为幻想乡的地域之一，迷途竹林的出场率高得有点过分了。
这样的场景和长笛是不是很配呢？
不管怎样请加油解决异变啊！ |translation =Stage 1 Theme. The theme is "meeting again" and "the future".
With old friends, our girls have begun yet another adventure. That kind of feeling.
As one of Gensokyo's locations, the Bamboo Forest's appearance rate is ridiculously high.
This kind of setting goes with flute really well, no?
No matter what, work hard to resolve the incident! |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =早在18年初就完成了的曲子。
作为1面道中曲，这首应该有挺多自己独特的风格在里面
这首曲子其实包含了不少感情，因为我想表达的东西非常多
和祈华梦最深层的主题直接相关的那种
具体的内容还是任君想象了 |translation1 =A track finished early on in 2018.
As the Stage 1 theme, this track should have a lot of its own unique style.
This tracks actually has many feelings within it, because I had a lot of things I wanted to express.
Things deeply tied with the core of ''Elegant Impermanence of Sakura'''s theme.
As for what those things exactly are, I'll leave them to your imagination, my esteemed reader. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 1 Boss - [[Kaguya Houraisan]]'s Theme |title =辉夜的指引 |titleEN =Kaguya's Guidance |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =原曲：竹取飛翔 ～ Lunatic Princess。
蓬莱山 辉夜 的主题曲。
这样来编配辉夜的旋律是不是很有一面的感觉？
原本打算和神灵庙一样，但在经过一年的考虑后果然还是决定加上辉夜的旋律。
曲子总体上还是一种路人甲感觉，达到目的了♪ |translation =Original Track: ''Flight of the Bamboo Cutter ~ Lunatic Princess''
Doesn't this arrangement of Kaguya's melody have a very "stage 1" feeling?
I originally wanted to do the same as Ten Desires, but after a year of consideration decided to include Kaguya's melody anyways.
As a whole, this track has a "Passerby Character A" sort of feeling, so I've reached my goal ♪. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =定位上和《Ghost Lead》一致的曲子
不过还是用了她作为6boss时的旋律
辉夜的旋律真是意外地适合1面boss曲
敲一敲鼓啥的挺欢快的www |translation1 =A track equivalent to ''Ghost Lead''
But I still used the melody from when she was a Stage 6 boss.
Kaguya's theme actually fits a Stage 1 boss quite well.
It's pretty cheerful to hit some drums, lol. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 2 Theme |title =流月牧夜歌 |titleEN =Flowing Moon Night Pastorale |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =第二面的主题曲，主题是「午夜」和「疾驰」。
这样的钢琴很有月光洒向大地的感觉呢。
作为二面的曲子，也算是别具一格了。
虽然不是什么严重的事件，但不去认真对待可不行哦。 |translation =Stage 2 theme. The themes are "midnight" and "to speed along".
Does it have the sensation of the moonlight spilling across the lands?
As a stage 2 theme, it's a quite unique style.
Although it's not a particularly severe incident, we can't not treat it seriously. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =完成于18年2月，是祈华梦最早作成的曲子
那时候我还处于学习东方风格音乐的写法的时期，除了乐器，没有使用太多原作的写法 |translation1 =Completed February 2018, the earliest track to be finished for ''Elegant Impermanence of Sakura''
At the time I was still learning how to write Touhou-style music, so besides instrumentation, I didn't use much style from the original works. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 2 Boss - Emitsu Kannazuki's Theme |title =失色的镜像世界 |titleEN =Colourless Mirror World |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =神无月 绘光 的主题曲。
作为云外镜的能力是映照出曾经见过的世界景象。
也就是说，和其他的妖怪一样，存在得越久远，她的力量就越强大。
虽然说她单作为通灵师而言，还需要继续努力学习……
但曲子会不会激烈过头了？ |translation =Emitsu Kannazuki's Theme
As an ungaikyo, her power is to reflect scenes of the world she's seen before.
As with other youkai, the longer she exists, the stronger her powers.
Although she's just a medium, she still needs to train hard
...but is the track a bit too hyped up? |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =和2道中曲一样，是自己的风格比较重的曲子
有种激战感 |translation1 =Same as the Stage 2 theme, a track containing more of my own style.
There's a feeling of an intense battle. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 3 Theme |title =林间烟雨小令 |titleEN =Little Tune for a Drizzle in the Forest |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =第三面的主题曲，主题是「悠然自得」。
黑幕不在妖怪之山上啊……
不过，从山上出发，想飞得高就更容易一点。
编曲方面，使用了排箫来体现一种轻快的感觉，是很悠扬的曲子。 |translation =Stage 3 Theme. The theme is "leisurely and contented"
The mastermind isn't on the Youkai Mountain, huh...
But leaving from the top of the Mountain would make it easier to fly higher.
In terms of composition, I used pan pipes to present a pleasant feeling, it's a very melodious track. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =名字和体验版不同是有意而为之
是很蹦跶的曲子。
和《永夜的报应》一样，既然有自机内战就要有东方主旋律 |translation1 =The different name from the demo<ref>The original name of this track in the demos was ''The Forest's Little Tune of Wind and Rain'' (林间风雨小令)</ref> is intended.
A very "disco" track.
Same as ''Retribution for the Eternal Night'', a battle between the protagonists has to have the main theme of Touhou. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 3A Bosses - [[Reimu Hakurei]] & [[Yukari Yakumo]]'s Theme |title =彼岸之云 结界之梦 |titleEN =Higan Clouds, Border Dreams |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =原曲：春色小径 ～ Colorful Path&二色蓮花蝶 ～ Red and White&ネクロファンタジア。
博丽 灵梦 & 八云 紫 的主题曲。一首打磨了很多遍的曲子。
最后还是敲定了使用春色小径作为灵梦部分的旋律，
因为我觉得春色小径的温柔感更适合这样的故事里的战斗。
紫的部分还是使用了妖妖梦里的旋律，不过也尽量温柔了很多。 |translation =Original Track: ''Spring Lane ~ Colorful Path'' & ''Dichromatic Lotus Butterfly ~ Red and White'' & ''Necrofantasia''
Reimu Hakurei & Yukari Yakumo's theme. A track that was reworked many times.
Finally, I decided to use Spring Lane as Reimu's theme,
because I felt Spring Lane's gentle nature felt more suitable for this story's battle.
Yukari's portion still used her melody from ''Perfect Cherry Blossom'', but I made it quite a bit more gentle. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =既然是双人战斗，于是在这首曲子中编入了两个人的主题曲的旋律
……总之感觉过渡的还行？尽力去做了
一首曲子融了3首曲子的旋律啊，哈哈 |translation1 =Since it's a battle of duos, I used both characters' melodies
...I feel like it works in a pinch? I tried my hardest.
One track with a mix of three other themes' melody, haha. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 3B Bosses - [[Marisa Kirisame]] & [[Yuyuko Saigyouji]]'s Theme |title =魔女和亡灵的★Dance Party |titleEN =The Witch and the Ghost's ★ Dance Party |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =原曲：魔女達の舞踏会&ゴーストリード。
雾雨 魔理沙 & 西行寺 幽幽子 的主题曲。
在这样的场合下战斗真的就像人和妖怪共舞的舞会呢，因此也做成舞会的感觉的曲子。
很适合魔理沙这种西洋风格的少女吧？旋律上也是魔理沙的旋律占了多数。
但是不管怎么说《Ghost Lead》真的很好听啊，我忍不住把它编了进来。
为什么有人说这首曲子像幽幽子在路边吃馍……真是难以理解。 |translation =Original Track: ''Witches' Ball'' & ''Ghost Lead''
Marisa Kirisame & Yuyuko Saigyouji's Theme.
Battling under these circumstances really feels like a ball with both humans and youkai dancing together. Because of that, I made a track with the feeling of a ball.
It really fits a Western-style girl like Marisa, huh? Marisa's melody also takes up most of the melody in the track.
But no matter what, Ghost Lead is too good, I couldn't help but add it in too.
Why have people said this theme sounds like Yuyuko is sitting beside the road eating bread? I don't understand. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =和上一首一样，含有2个人物的主题曲的旋律的混编曲
曾经这个位置的曲子使用了墨染樱的旋律……我已经全盘否定了
6面的旋律放在3面，怎么看都很违和 |translation1 =Like the previous track, a mix of the two character's melodies.
The track that used to be in this one's place used to use ''Ink-Black Cherry Blossom'''s melody...but I've completely rejected it.
Putting a stage 6 track in stage 3 feels out of place no matter how you look at it. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 3C Bosses - [[Fujiwara no Mokou]] & [[Keine Kamishirasawa]]'s Theme |title =Imaginary History |titleEN =Imaginary History |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =原曲：プレインエイジア&月まで届け、不死の煙。
上白泽 慧音 & 藤原 妹红 的主题曲。
编曲模式上和前两首曲子一样。
这一次故事可是神主以前留下关于妹红的故事的续集啊。
妹红可千万不能输在这里了。虽然说就算被打败了也会继续的。
曲子也是体现了激烈战斗的感觉。 |translation =Original Tracks: ''Plain Asia'' & ''Reach for the Moon, Immortal Smoke''
Keine Kamishirasawa & Fujiwara no Mokou's theme.
Compositionally, similar to the previous two tracks.
The story this time around is a continuation of a story line ZUN left regarding Mokou.
No matter what, Mokou can't lose here, even though she'll still continue after being defeated.
The track also presented the feeling of an intense battle. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =和前两首一样，是把两个人的主题曲的旋律混编的曲子
这样拼起来比较流畅，我也就这么写了
不过……旋律的位置安排是否合理这种问题，到底是有理论可依的还是纯粹的先入为主啊，不是很明白 |translation1 =Like the previous track, a mix of the two character's melodies.
Putting it together like this flows better, so I did it this way.
But...as for whether the positions of the melodies makes sense, I still don't quite understand whether there's theory to follow or whether it should purely be "first impression wins". }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 4 Theme |title =万华镜之箱 |titleEN =The Box of Kaleidoscopes |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =第四面的主题曲，主题是「早上八点的阳光」和「云海」。
旋律改编自黑猫92的曲子，早在2年前就已经成曲了。
东方祈华梦正式版开发工作的第一曲，与此同时东方祈华梦的主线故事也拉开了帷幕。
这种风格的曲子是不是很有云海上悠然自得的感觉？
其实大家也都没有很认真在解决异变吧。 |translation =Stage 4 theme. Themes are "8:00 AM sunlight" and "sea of clouds"
Melody is adapted from 黑猫92's [https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1DW411t7zb track], which already came out two years ago.
The first track made for Elegant Impermanence of Sakura's full release, at the same time raising the curtain on Elegant Impermanence of Sakura's main storyline.
Doesn't this style of track have a feeling of leisure and content in a sea of clouds?
To be honest, everyone hasn't been very serious in resolving the incident. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =4面道中曲，应该是整个游戏的BGM里相当满意的一首了
大概就是在云海上欣赏绝景的感觉吧
啊啊，这首曲子没用zun号，作为我的曲子真的很少见
悠然自得嘛，就应该用萨克斯，或者说这才是萨克斯的正确用法 |translation1 =Stage 4 theme, one of the tracks I'm quite satisfied with in the entire game's BGM.
The feeling is something like that of enjoying spectacular views in a sea clouds.
Ah, this track doesn't use ZUNpets, a rarity for my tracks.
Carefree and leisurely calls for sax. Put another way, this is the only correct way of using sax. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 4 Boss - Hisoka Uroki's Theme |title =Mystery is Your Mirage |titleEN =Mystery is Your Mirage |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =虚城 妃奏华 的主题曲。
开头用了歌剧魅影的旋律，很有大BOSS的感觉吧。
虽然这回4面Boss不是黑幕，只是一般意义上的守门人。
但她也是拼尽了全力守护浅间神社的神秘，旋律上也尽力体现出这一点了。
不过曲子编成了西洋风。 |translation =Hisoka Uroki's Theme
I used ''Phantom of the Opera'''s theme in the beginning, it has the feeling of a major boss, no?
Although, the stage 4 boss isn't the mastermind this time around, just a regular gatekeeper.
Yet she still tries her hardest to guard Asama Shrine's mystery, and the melody strives to show this.
But then the track became Western-style. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =嗯……比较摇摆的感觉吧，与其说是幻术师，更像是魔术师
本来应该加一些古灵精怪的音色更好一点
但那样的话感觉就变成了万圣节啊，女巫啊之类的印象
作为一个东洋和西洋风格结合的人物，我还是控制了一下太多西洋乐的东西 |translation1 =Umm...a somewhat more swaying feeling. Instead of calling her an illusionist, calling her a magician would be more correct.
It would've been better if I added a stranger color.
But if I did that, it would've given the impression of things like Halloween or witches.
As a character that mixes styles from East and West, I controlled the amount of Western things. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 5 Theme |title =樱花飞舞的浅间神社 |titleEN =Cherry Blossoms Dancing on Asama Shrine |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =原曲：さくらさくら ～ Japanize Dream...
第五面的主题曲，主题是「空寂」。
和原作5面那普遍比较悲伤的感觉一脉相承。
尽力去营造了曲径通幽处的氛围，也有柳暗花明又一村的感觉。
让人感到心旷神怡但又凄神寒骨呢。 |translation =Original Track: ''Sakura Sakura ~ Japanize Dream...''
Stage 5 Theme. The theme is "quiet skies".
Continues the official games' trend of stage 5 themes overall being more sorrowful.
I tried my hardest to create an atmosphere of "Following a winding path to a quiet place"<ref>「曲径通幽处」is from Chang Jian's poem "A Buddhist Retreat Behind Broken-mountain Temple"</ref>, yet it also has the feeling of "out of the shade, comes bright flowers and a village"<ref>From Lu You's poem "[https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Translation:Touring_Shanxi_Village Touring Shanxi Village]"</ref>
It relaxes one's heart yet also chills one's soul and bones. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =5面的道中曲应该也可以说是最满意的一首了……
这个钢琴其实参考了许多动画OST曲子的写法，并不是很纯粹的游戏风格
但是放在这里很合适，甚至有人还觉得很感人
打弹幕游戏的时候可不能眼眶湿润啊(^ ^) |translation1 =The Stage 5 theme is probably the one I'm most satisfied with...
This piano was inspired by the style in many anime OST's, and isn't purely video game style.
But putting it here fits, and some people even think it's very emotional.
Don't tear up when playing danmaku games (^ ^) }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 5 Boss - Inori Jinguuji's Pre-Battle Theme |title =徒名草之道 ～神宫寺祈前哨战～ |titleEN =Sakura<ref>徒名草 is another name for sakura</ref> Path ~Jinguuji Skirmish~ |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =神宫寺 祈 前哨战的主题曲。
编成了比较柔和的曲子，作为BOSS曲而言不够激烈。
但是作为性格柔弱，还没下定决心的巫女小姐的主题曲实在是恰到好处。
实际上这首曲子在游戏中应该只会听到十几秒……
过会儿她可就没有这么乖巧了。 |translation =Inori Jinguuji's Skirmish Theme.
A rather gentle track, not exciting enough to be a boss track.
But perfect for a gentle-hearted shrine maiden who is still indecisive.
In reality, this track can only be heard ingame for about 10-20 seconds...
After a while she won't be so docile anymore. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =这首本来打算扔进未使用曲专辑里的……
不过结合文案的想法，祈要有一个从退缩变得坚强的转变
所以才有了前2张非符……这首曲子也就派上用场了 |translation1 =This track was originally going to be thrown into the album of unused tracks...
But in the plot, Inori has a transition from cowering to being strong.
So that's why there were the two nonspells at the beginning...and this song found its use as well. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 5 Boss - Inori Jinguuji's Theme |title =华彩飞扬 ～ Indomitable Kagura |titleEN =Flying Colours ~ Indomitable Kagura |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =神宫寺 祈 的主题曲。
用了日本雅乐中常用的乐器来制造巫女的感觉。
世道变迁，沧海桑田，不过是黄粱一梦罢了。
但她这一回则一定会不屈不挠地反抗命运。 |translation =Inori Jinguuji's Theme.
I used instruments commonly used in Japanese ''gagaku'' to create the feeling of a shrine maiden.
The world's evolving morals, the changingness of the world, it's all but a decadent dream.
But this time, she will persevere in resisting fate. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =因为祈是巫女，说到巫女那肯定就有日本的雅乐
为此我专门去欣赏分析了不少那样的曲子……尽量把它的特点融进曲子里了，不知道有没有人听的出来
啊啊，但是电吉他怎么说也太现代了吧
古今结合吗…… |translation1 =Inori is a shrine maiden, and once you speak of shrine maidens you have to have Japan's ''gagaku''.
For this track I purposefully listened to and analyzed many songs like that, and strove to work their special qualities into this track. I don't know if anyone can her it.
Ah, but electric guitar is still too modern, huh?
A fusion of ancient and modern, huh... }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 6 Theme |title =一念的繁华 |titleEN =One Moment's Splendour<ref>繁华 (splendor) is a pun with 繁花 (splendid/illustrious flowers). The title refers to Shizuka causing Asama Shrine's "splendid flowers" to all bloom at "one moment" at the beginning of the stage.</ref> |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =第六面的主题曲，主题是「变易」和「繁华」。
幻想乡此时应该是寒冷的初春，但所谓荣华之神，就是如此善变。
为了迎接千年以来的第一位客人，她让满庭的樱花绽放。
并没有很强的大战在即的感觉，而是一种马上要开宴会了的欢庆感。 |translation =Stage 6 Theme. Themes are "changing" and "illustrious flowers".
Gensokyo is supposed to be in the cold of early spring, but the so-called god of splendour has made such an improvement occur.
To welcome the first visitor in thousands of years, she made all the sakura in the garden bloom.
There's no strong feeling of an impeding showdown, rather the festivity that comes when a feast is about to be held. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =没有参考原作任何一首曲子，完完全全是由我自己的风格作成的6面道中曲
这个长度的道中无论是原作还是同人游戏，都算是很长了吧
祈华梦真是个道中游戏
顺带一提，未使用曲专辑里有前半段的延长版 |translation1 =A Stage 6 theme made without referencing any track from the original works, completely from my own style.
The length of this stage is pretty long compared to both the original works or fangames.
''Elegant Impermanence of Sakura'' really is a stage game.
By the way, the unused track album has an extended version of the first half. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 6 Boss - Shizuka Oukain's Theme |title =春彩动荡之寂 ～盛樱之世～ |titleEN =Impermanence of Spring-Coloured Ripples<ref>寂 refers to ''sabi'' in the Japanese term [[Wikipedia: Wabi-sabi | Wabi-sabi]].</ref> ~World of Blooming Sakura~ |composer =百灵猫neko, H2SO4 |comment =樱华院 静 的主题曲。
始于荣华，瞬间便归于凋零。她就是掌管着变易的神明。
热烈的，祭典般的宴席，所谓神代的春之色彩。不由自主地会联想到樱花漫野的盛景吧。
但神明所绘制的，永不落幕的盛春之典。又何止椿花可令春日动荡？ |translation =Shizuka Oukain's Theme.
Starting from illustriousness, yet returning to nothingness within a moment. She is a god that controls change.
An impassioned, ritualistic feast is the so-called divine colour of spring. One naturally thinks of the illustrious scene of cherry blossom petals flying all about.
Yet the unending festival of spring that the gods have created. How could only the ''tsubaki'' stir the spring? |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =做成偶像的感觉的6boss曲，不是鬼形兽那种偶像
中间部分使用了《辉针城的小人族》的音色来增加最终战的拉锯感
其他部分完全是我和猫步聚聚共同的原创的风格，特别是高潮部分 |translation1 =A Stage 6 boss theme with a feeling of "idols", but unlike the kind of idols in ''Wily Beast and Weakest Character''.
In the middle portions I used the color of ''Inchlings of the Shining Needle'' to increase the back-and-forth sensation of a final battle.
The other parts are a completely original style by me and H2SO4, especially the climax portion. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Extra Stage Theme |title =灵空猝灭雨 |titleEN =Quenching<ref>The term 猝灭 here refers to [[Wikipedia: Quenching| quenching]], the process by which a material is rapidly cooled. This is a reference to Ei's power of stillness.</ref> Rain of Mystical Skies |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =EX面的主题曲，主题是「空灵的夜晚」和「疾驰」。
距离上一次前往外界也已经过去了几年。
此时的外界，无非还是灯红酒绿，纸醉金迷。
人们忙碌着，重复着不变的生活。 |translation =Extra Stage Theme. Themes are "mystical skies" and "hurrying onwards".
It's been a few years since we've visited the outside world.
The outside world nowadays is most certainly still full of debauchery and decadence.
The people are busy, repeating their unchanging lives. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =钢琴部分的灵感来自于《再也无法进入门里》
不过没有那么沉重啦，最后写成了一首非常空灵澄澈的曲子
这种曲式结构也是和大部分ex关卡的曲子一脉相承 |translation1 =Piano portion was inspired by ''No More Going Through Doors''.
But it's not as somber as that one, in the end I wrote a song that was quite bright.
This kind of structuring is in vein with most other extra stage themes. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Extra Boss - Ei Iwabuchi's Theme |title =富士大人之侘 ～我心匪石～ |titleEN =Permanence of Fuji-san<ref>侘 refers to ''wabi'' in the Japanese term [[Wikipedia: Wabi-sabi | Wabi-sabi]].</ref> ~My Heart is No Stone~<ref>From the ancient Chinese [https://oll.libertyfund.org/titles/2109#Jennings_1440_830 Classic of Poetry], where the full phrase is "No stone this heart of mine is, That may be turned and rolled;"</ref> |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =岩渊 永 的主题曲。
编曲上体现了她的不动如山，就如同她的神性一样。
但是也使用了温柔的旋律，就和她的性格一样。
虽然相看两厌，但她还是爱着妹妹。 |translation =Ei Iwabuchi's Theme
In composition I expressed her steadfast personality, just like her divinity.
But I also used a more gentle melody, just like her personality.
Even though the two have a mutual disliking, she still loves her little sister. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =最直观的感觉肯定是很像《哈德曼的妖怪少女》吧
然而其实这首曲子有4处neta了原作的曲子的写法
请猜一猜是哪4首曲子吧 |translation1 =The strongest and most direct feeling is probably that this is a lot like ''Hartmann's Youkai Girl'', right?
Actually, this track has four places that have neta-ed the writing style of tracks from the original works.
Take a guess which four tracks those are! }} {{MusicRoom |category =Ending Theme |title =落花残响 |titleEN =Remnant Echo of Falling Flowers |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =Ending的主题曲。尽力体现了伤春之情。
参考了多首原作的曲子，有那种寂寞感，不过还是以我自己的风格为主。
最后很莫名其妙地激昂起来了呢。 |translation =Ending Theme. I strove to show a feeling of "nothing gold can stay".
I referenced a lot of tracks from the original works for that feeling of loneliness, but my own style is still in the majority.
At the end, it strangely begins to get worked up. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =……主旋律部分前六个音和《麓之神社》一样真是很抱歉
听那首曲子比较多的人，听这首曲子的时候可能会觉得很奇怪
虽然构思的时候完全是按着《春风之梦》和《花如幻想一般》来的 |translation1=...Sorry that the first six notes of the melody are the same as ''Shrine at the Foot of the Mountain''.
Those who listen to that track often may find it quite strange when listening to this track.
Even though I structured this track in line with ''Dream of a Spring Breeze'' and ''The Flowers Remain in Fantasy''. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Staff Roll Theme |title =幻想乡的神隐少女 |titleEN =Spirited-Away Girls<ref>神隐少女 is the Chinese name of the famous anime film ''Spirited Away''</ref> of Gensokyo |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =Staff的主题曲。
神隐少女是说我自己吗？
我才不要去幻想乡那种地方。 |translation =The staff theme.
Does "Spirited-Away Girl" refer to me?
I wouldn't want to go somewhere like Gensokyo. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =比较悠然自得的曲子，其实曲名和游戏没什么关系 |translation1 =A more carefree and leisurely track. The track name actually has nothing to do with the game. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Player's Score Theme |title =Player's Score |titleEN =Player's Score |composer =百灵猫neko |comment =满身疮痍时的主题曲，可以说是最不希望听到的曲子了。
和原作使用了一样的配器，但是部分换成了自己的旋律。
时间上要长一点，不过只有前几秒能发挥作用……大概。 |translation =The gameover theme, the theme you don't want to hear the most.
I used the same accompanying instruments as the original works, but switched parts out for my own melody.
The running time is a bit longer, but only the first few seconds are useful...probably. |source1 =Omake.txt |comment1 =和原作一样使用了风神录里的旋律……
后面接了绘光的旋律
之所以选她，是因为做这首曲子的时候后面的boss曲都还没做 |translation1 =Same as the original works, I used the melody from ''Mountain of Faith''...
and then later connected it to Emitsu's melody.
The reason I chose her was because when composing this track I still hadn't done any of the later boss tracks. }}
==Unused Tracks== An additional album of unused tracks was made available alongside the game's OST on Steam, coming with its own set of comments (未使用曲曲评.txt). {{TranslateTable/Header}} {{TranslateTable | ja =恭喜你发现了隐藏的文档
不过这里没有什么宝藏，只是评述一下未使用曲和解释它们为什么会是未使用曲
嗯，关于这几年的开发过程中不为人知的故事
「有声的音乐述说着无声的故事」 | en =Congratulations on discovering a hidden document.
But this isn't some hoard of treasure, just a description of the unused tracks and why they are unused.
And, stories no one knew about the development process these past few years.
"Sounding music tells a silent tale" }} {{TranslateTable/Footer}}
{{MusicRoom |category =Shizuka Oukain's Alternate Theme |title =参见樱华院大人 |titleEN =All Hail Lady Oukain |comment =樱华院静的另一首主题曲，和平的时候用
原本打算让玩家在通关Normal难度之后就换一套主菜单主题和标题曲……不过全部都没时间做了
这首曲子也只好放在未使用曲了 |translation =Shizuka Oukain's alternate theme, for use during peaceful time
Originally, we decided that after the player cleared Normal difficulty, we would change the Menu and Title Theme...but we didn't have time for any of it.
So this track could only go into the unused tracks. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Unused Stage 1 Theme |title =人间之里的秋雾 |titleEN =Autumn Mist of the Human Village |comment =成曲于17年7月，是我做的第一首东方风自作曲
各个方面都非常不成熟。
原本打算用作一面道中曲，背景是黄昏的人里附近
不过被神风以「辉夜没有理由去人里」而否决了 |translation =Completed July 2017, and my first Touhou-style original track
Various aspects are very immature.
Originally intended to be used for the Stage 1 theme, with the Human Village at dusk nearby.
But 神风 rejected it with a "Kaguya has no reason to go to the Human Village". }} {{MusicRoom |category =Unused Stage 3 Theme |title =十四年的永夜抄 |titleEN =Fourteen Years of Imperishable Night |comment =之所以这么取名是因为这一关有自机内战，并且作曲的时候距离永夜抄发售才14年（现在已经16年了）
这首曲子原本计划用于3面道中，成曲于18年3月，我高考的前几个月的时候
当时特别喜欢深苍穹的曲子……这首曲子最初的灵感便是来自于他的《嘲笑的轮舞曲 ～ sneer of woods》
应该挺多地方都有这首曲子的感觉的……吧？
不过，我加上了东方的主旋律，因为永夜抄4面自机内战的道中曲也有东方主旋律
这一部分也保留到了正式版的曲子中，至于其他么……就在这里了 |translation =This name was given because this stage has infighting between the protagonists, and when this was composed, ''Imperishable Night'' had been released for 14 years (now 16 years).
This track was originally planned for use as the Stage 3 theme, completed March 2018, a few months before I took the [[Wikipedia:National_College_Entrance_Examination|Gaokao]].
At the time I really liked Misora's tracks...the initial inspiration for this track was his ''Ridicule Rondo ～ sneer of woods''.
A lot of places in this track should have that track's feeling...probably?
But, I added Touhou's main melody, because Imperishable Night's Stage 4 protagonist infighting also uses it in the stage theme.
This portion was kept in the track in the full release, but the rest...is here. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Reimu and Yukari's Old Theme |title =彼岸之云 结界之梦 |titleEN =Higan Clouds, Border Dreams |comment =原本用于灵梦与紫的Boss战的曲子（甚至保留到了最后的体验版）
不过我觉得这么做曲子不行，毕竟原曲的成分实在太多了
所以灵梦部分干脆重做了，紫的部分也改了不少
还是希望有自己的风格一点吧 |translation =Originally used for Reimu and Yukari's boss battle (even as late as the final demo)
But I felt like it wouldn't work to compose this way, since there was too much of the original tracks.
So I went ahead and remade Reimu's portion, and adjusted Yukari's portion quite a bit.
I hoped to have a bit more of my own style. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Marisa and Yuyuko's Old Theme |title =朦胧夜雨 彼岸幽樱 |titleEN =Misty Night Rain, Elegant Ghostly Sakura |comment =原本用于魔理沙与幽幽子的Boss战的曲子（甚至保留到了最后的体验版）
同样的，原曲的成分实在太多，6boss的旋律不适合放在三面，恋色master spark的旋律也实在有点听腻了
所以干脆，全部重做了
不过我想这首曲子也许有人会喜欢，所以还是放到这张专辑里了
这个组很喜欢重做呢，嗯 |translation =Originally used for Marisa and Yuyuko's boss battle (even as last as the final demo)
Likewise, there was too much of the original tracks, a stage 6 boss melody doesn't fit in stage 3, and I was getting a bit tired of hearing Love-Coloured Master Spark's melody.
So I just went ahead and remade everything.
But I thought that some people would still like this track, so I put it in this album.
This team really like remaking things, hm? }} {{MusicRoom |category =Hisoka Uroki's Unused Theme |title =不存在仙人的空之岛 |titleEN =Island in the Sky Devoid of Celestials |comment =成曲于18年3月，原本用于4面Boss战的曲子.
其实真的不太好听（直球
春虫岚写的天空璋鼓还是不错的
别的，没什么。 |translation =Completed March 2018, originally used as the Stage 4 boss battle theme.
It really doesn't sound that good (straight ball).
春虫岚's ''Hidden Star in Four Seasons'' drums are not bad.
Otherwise, not much here. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Unused Stage 5 Theme |title =空中神社 ～ acient legacy {{sic}} |titleEN =Shrine in the Sky ~ acient legacy |comment =成曲于18年4月，原曲是Min聚聚的《空中神社》
这首是我的瞎改
一开始打算用在5面，毕竟这个曲名和祈华梦的剧情实在是惊人的巧合，实在是太合适了，而且这首曲子也是真的非常好听
后来还是觉得……就这样直接用别人的曲子，实在是不太好，于是重做了
感谢ZXBOLI的混音 |translation =Completed April 2018, original track is Min's "Shrine in the Sky"
This track is me blindly rearranging it.
In the beginning, this was to be used in Stage 5, since this track name was shockingly fitting for ''Elegant Impermanence of Sakura'''s plot, and this track really does sound very good.
Later I felt...using someone's track directly like this, really isn't that good, so I remade it.
Thanks to ZXBOLI for mixing the sound. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Alternate Stage 6 Theme |title =千年的侘寂 |titleEN =Wabi-sabi of One Thousand Years |comment =前半部分和现在的6道中一样，后半部分砍掉了
对，这首曲子是《一念的繁华》前半部分的完整版
其实是很悲伤的曲子，最初的印象就是妹红1300年的孤独
后来我权衡了一下……唔，这样的6面Boss，做这么悲伤的曲子实在不合适
所以后半部分全砍了，前半部分没砍是因为和冬天的气息还挺配的
而且突然气氛的转变，也让人心潮澎湃 |translation =The first half is the same as the current stage 6 theme, with the second half chopped off.
Correct, this track is a full version of the first half of ''One Moment's Splendour''.
It's quite a sorrowful track, my first impression was Mokou's 1300 years of loneliness.
Later I reassessed it...hm, this sorrowful of a track really doesn't fit such a stage 6 boss.
So I cut all of the second half. The reason the first half wasn't cut was because it still matches the atmosphere of winter quite well. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Shizuka Oukain's Skirmish Theme |title =樱华院静前哨战 |titleEN =Shizuka Oukain Skirmish |comment =关注我的人应该都知道我是ff14玩家
所以本来打算模仿ff14的Boss战那样做一首前哨战的曲子，然后用在6面Boss战中
但是说实话，STG不适合那种模式，非常不适合
那就不做了咯 |translation =Anyone who follows me should know that I'm a FFXIV player.
So originally I intended to imitate FFXIV's boss fights and make a skirmish theme, and use it during the stage 6 boss fight.
But to be honest, STG's don't fit that sort of setting, they really don't.
So I didn't do it. }} {{MusicRoom |category =Unused Extra Stage Theme |title =死神少女 ～ Dead Space |titleEN =Shinigami Girls ~ Dead Space |comment =这首曲子的作曲其实14年就完成了（这就是为什么曲名这么中二）
这个版本的remix是11在17年7月完成的
原本打算用于ex面道中，不过还是觉得14年的作曲水平实在不行，所以干脆不用这首曲子了
高速钢琴其实还不错（？） |translation =This track was actually already completed in 2014 (This is why the track name is so ''chuuni'').
This remix version was completed by 11 in July 2017.
Originally planned to use this in the Extra stage, but I felt like my 2014 composing skills just weren't enough, so I didn't use this track.
The rapid piano isn't bad though (?) }} {{MusicRoom |category =Ei Iwabuchi's Unused Theme |title =八岳山的破晓 |titleEN =Dawn of Yatsugatake |comment =本用于Ex面Boss战的曲子
应该听的出来有模仿祖坚摇滚的意思在里面……不过我完全不会玩电吉他，写出来的东西没意思还糊的不行
所以就不用了
但是啊，摇滚的音乐风格确实很适合Boss战，只是我没写好，以后有机会一定要尝试 |translation =A track originally used for the extra boss fight.
You can hear an attempt at imitating [[Wikipedia:Masayoshi Soken|Soken]]'s rock and roll...but I don't know how to use guitars at all, so what I wrote was meaningless and unclear.
So I didn't use it.
But, rock and roll style does fit boss battles very well, it's just I didn't do a good job. If I have the opportunity in the future I'll definitely try it. }}
==Notes== {{reflist}}

==Music List== {{MusicRoom | category =Title Screen | title =赤より紅い夢 | roma =Aka yori akai yume | titleEN =A Dream More Scarlet than Red | comment =タイトル画面テーマです。
東方なんで、和風にしてみました。いやほんと。
ゲームはまるで和風じゃ無いくせに(^^;
ＳＴＧとは思えないような曲です。
そもそも、タイトル画面に曲は必要なのでしょうか（笑）？ | translation =The title theme.
It's Japanese-feeling, because it's [[Touhou]] (Eastern). No, really.
However, it's not like the game is (^^;
This doesn't sound like a [[shooting game]] piece.
For that matter, is having a song on the title screen even necessary at all? (Laughs) | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　タイトル画面の曲です。
　　通常なら「東方紅魔郷」とゲームのタイトルをつけるところですが、
　　曲調しんみりしすぎてるので、やめました(^^;
　　今回は「紅」がキーワードです。紅が色々盛り込まれています。 | translation1 =The song for the title screen.
Normally, I would title it "Touhou Koumakyou" like the game,
but since the melody sounded too subtle, I didn't. (^^;
This time "scarlet" is the keyword. There are all kinds of scarlets put in. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 theme | title =ほおずきみたいに紅い魂 | roma =Hoozuki-mitai ni akai tamashii | titleEN =A Soul as Scarlet as a Ground Cherry | comment =１面テーマです。
夜の森をイメージしてあります。一面だし、曲に勇ましさがあると
やる気が出るかなと思い、ちょっと元気のある曲を目指しました。
勇ましさというかコミカルな百鬼夜行って感じかな？ | translation =Stage 1 theme.
The image of a midnight forest. As it's the first stage, I aimed for something a little energetic, so hopefully people would get into it.
But isn't it something a little more comical and hectic? | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　宵闇に鬼灯（ほおずき）のように紅く丸く、ふらふら漂っている魂．．．
　　よくあるただの鬼火です。ほおずきは季節ものですし、花言葉は「欺瞞」。
　　季節ものつっても、夏コミだから夏。場合によっては冬以降のコミケで
　　買う方も要るかもしれないのに... | translation1 =A soul that's as red and round as a hozuki floating away aimlessly in the darkness of dawn.
It's just a common ball of fire. A hozuki is a seasonal flower and its meaning is "trickery".
Even though I say seasonal it's going to be sold at the summer comiket so the season is summer. There could be people buying it at the winter comiket too... | note1 ="Trickery" in this context is considered trickery of others starting by tricking one's self. Hozuki (ほおずき) is a Japanese lantern plant. Physalis alkekengi. It is also used in comparison to balls of fire that are said to be the soul of the dead that remain on earth. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 Boss - [[Rumia]]'s theme | title =妖魔夜行 | roma =Youma yakou | titleEN =Apparitions Stalk the Night | comment =ルーミアのテーマです。
この曲に限らず、今回、全体的に軽快な曲になっています。
この曲は夜の妖怪をイメージしました、
　　・・・って言っても良いんだろうか(^^;
ノリ的には結構馬鹿っぽいです。 | translation =Rumia's theme.
Not just this, but all the music this time is meant to be light.
This comes from an image of [[youkai]] of the night
...or, at least, I hope so (^^;
It's fairly relaxed and a little silly. | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　ヨーマヤコーってかくとブータン人みたい。
　　この辺はまだ、熾烈な闘いのイメージが少ないので、爽やかに。
　　妖魔以外の魔は妖しくないの？ | translation1 ="You-Ma-Ya-Kou" it sort of sounds like somebody from Bhutan.
Since images of fierce heated fights are still small in numbers, the music is something that feels fresh.
Is a devil魔 that's not a youma妖魔 not charming妖? | note1 =ZUN is playing with breaking the words apart and putting them back together again. The characters for youma (妖魔) are used for charming (妖しい) and devil (魔). }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 theme | title =ルーネイトエルフ | roma =Rūneito erufu | titleEN =Lunate Elf | comment =２面テーマです。
水と霧をイメージして、ちょっと不気味さも混ぜて見ました。
過去の東方のイメージとほとんど同じ感じとも言える。
２面って言うと、なんの為にあるのかよく分からないからなぁ(^^; | translation =Stage 2 theme.
I thought of water and mist, and mixed an omen or two.
In many ways, it resembles the feel of older titles.
I don't really know why there's a Stage 2 anyway (^^; | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　ここでいうエルフは耳の尖った例のアレ、じゃなくて、妖精そのもの
　　を指しています。意味はまるでありません。
　　妖精以外の精は妖しくないの？ | translation1 =The elf that's referred to here is not the one with the pointy ears but the fairy. There's no meaning to this.
Is spirit精 that's not a fairy妖精 not charming妖? | note1 =Same wordplay as the previous track. The characters for yousei (妖精) are used for charming (妖しい) and spirit (精). }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 Boss - [[Cirno]]'s theme | title =おてんば恋娘 | roma =Otenba koimusume | titleEN =Tomboyish Girl in Love | comment =チルノのテーマです。
やっぱり、頭の悪い少女をイメージしてます。
その割には明るいんだか暗いんだか分からない曲に仕上がって
なんとも。ハイスピードにしっとりしたメインメロディとか。
まぁ、２面だし（ぉ | translation =Cirno's theme.
I actually did think of a dim-witted girl for this.
However, I don't know if what came out can be considered bright or dark. The tempo is pretty fast, but...
Well, it's stage 2. (ha) | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　頭の悪そうな曲を作りたかったので、まず曲名から頭を悪くしました。
　　言葉の響きや文字の見た目がなんか頭悪いです。
　　その割にピアノメロディは、ちょっとエキゾチック感も混ぜて、
　　個人的に萌え萌えです。 | translation1 =I wanted to make a stupid sounding song so I started by making the title sound stupid.
The sound of the words and the look of the characters are a bit stupid.
At the same time, I mixed in a piano melody that gives an exotic feeling to it. It's a personal "moe-moe". }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 theme | title =上海紅茶館　～ {{lang|en|Chinese Tea}} | roma =Shanhai kouchakan | titleEN =Shanghai Scarlet Teahouse ~ Chinese Tea |also ={{CoSD}} | comment =３面テーマです。
中華風に仕上げる予定でしたが、結果そんなでも無いようです(^^;
でも曲は東洋風です。４面以降に東洋風の曲を作ることが出来なさ
そうだったので、ここでつくっときました(^^;
Fusionというより New Age風かな？ | translation =Stage 3 theme.
I intended to make it more Chinese, but it didn't quite work out. (^^;
However it's still Oriental, because I knew it would be hard to put Oriental songs past stage 4 (^^;
It's more New Age rather than Fusion, I guess? | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　中国っぽくしたかったのですが、結局あまり中国ではないですね（汗）
　　最近、紅茶飲んでないなぁ。血の紅茶って業が深い。
　　というか、レミリア達の飲んでいる紅茶はただの人間の血なんですが、
　　お茶と言って良いの？ | translation1 =I wanted Chinese sounding but it didn't end up Chinese at all. (Sweats)
I haven't drank black tea in a while. But black tea made of blood is very sinful.
Well, the black tea that Remilia and such are drinking is really just human blood.
