Can I really call that black tea? }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 Boss - [[Hong Meiling]]'s theme | title =明治十七年の上海アリス | roma =Meiji juunana nen no shanhai arisu | titleEN =Shanghai Alice of Meiji 17 |also ={{DiPP}} | comment =紅　美鈴（ホン・メイリン）のテーマです。
欧羅巴の香りとゲーム音楽の香りを混ぜてあります。(2:8位で)
中華でも何でも無いあたりがアレです。上海のフランス租界をイメ
ージしているからです。
もっとも、美鈴も人間では無いみたいだけど、何者なんだろう（ぉ | translation =Hong Meiling's theme.
A hint of Europe, mixed with game music. (a 2:8 ratio)
It's strange that it's not more Chinese, but that's because it's composed with the image of the French settlement in Shanghai in mind.
But, Meiling looks like she's not human. Then what is she... (eh) | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　この頃の上海はいかほどだったのでしょう？
　　明治十七年は、清仏戦争の年です。
　　外国租界を含め、これほど「魔都」の名前が似合う都市は無いですね。
　　ちなみに「魔都」とは「魔界都市 - 新宿 -」の略ではありません。 | translation1 =I wonder how Shanghai would be at this time?
Meiji 17th year1884 C.E. is the year of the Sino-French war.
With foreign concession, there's no better city that suits the name of such a "Mato".
And "Mato" is not a short form of [[Wikipedia:Demon City Shinjuku|"Makai city - Shinjyuku"]]. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4 theme | title =ヴワル魔法図書館 | roma =Vuwaru mahou toshokan | titleEN =Voile, the Magic Library | comment =４面テーマです。
この面から室内ステージです。曲も室内の雰囲気を出してみまし
た。後半、中ボスあたりから不気味さが出るように曲調が変化し
ます。
それ以外には特に特徴も無いですが、強いていえば、ＳＴＧの曲
ではない（笑） | translation =Stage 4 theme.
From here, the game moves indoors, so it's composed with indoor atmospheres in mind. Its tone shifts to something more ominous halfway through the song, where you would normally meet the mid-stage boss.
Other than that, there's nothing special about this theme, but really, it's not a shooting game piece (Laughs) | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　魔導書などの専門の図書館があってもいいんじゃないかと。
　　急にファンタジー。って、一応全体的にファンタジーのつもりですが
　　ヴワルというのは固有名詞なんで余り意味ありません。
　　フランス語かなんかで、なんか意味があります（笑） | translation1 =I think it's a legitimate idea to have libraries that specialized in grimoires.
It's a fantasy setting all of a sudden. Well, I meant it to be fully fantasy from the start. Voile doesn't have much of a meaning in terms of a proper noun.
However, it does have a meaning in French or something. (Laughs) }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4 Boss - [[Patchouli Knowledge]]'s theme | title =ラクトガール　～ 少女密室 | roma =Rakuto gāru ~ Shoujo misshitsu | titleEN =Locked Girl ~ The Girl's Sealed Room |also ={{R53m}} | comment =パチュリー・ノーレッジのテーマです。
ああ、またいつもの悪い病気が...
暗い曲です。こんなにも激しいのに明るさも軽快さも感じません
もうちょっと気持ちよければいいんですが、この曲聴くと微妙に
暗い気分になる感じがします（笑） | translation =Patchouli Knowledge's theme.
Again with this sick feeling...
It's a dark song, without any light or bright moments, despite its quite fast-paced nature.
It could stand to be a little less heavy, as listening to this piece could drag someone down (Laughs) | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　{{lang|en|Locked Girl}}、鍵っ娘です。{{lang|en|Key}}とは特に関係はありません。
　　日陰大好き、不健康少女。
　　ちなみに密室、密室で殺人する意味ってあんまないですよね。
　　私は密室自殺なら出来そうです。 | translation1 ="Locked Girl." A latchkey girl, if you will. It has nothing to do with [[Wikipedia:Key (company)|Key]].
She's an unhealthy girl who loves the shade.
By the way, speaking of [[wikipedia:Locked-room_mystery|sealed rooms]]... there's not much of an actual point to killing someone in one, is there?
I could probably pull off a locked-room suicide, myself. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 theme | title =メイドと血の懐中時計 | roma =Meido to chi no kaichuu dokei | titleEN =The Maid and the Pocket Watch of Blood | comment =５面のテーマです
不思議な不思議な曲です。スピードを出そうとしてつんのめりそ
うな曲になってるのは、特殊な拍子のせいでしょうか？
ロックにしたかったんですが、私はあまりロックを聴かない所為
か、ロックというものを誤解している可能性大(^^; | translation =Stage 5 theme.
A very mysterious song. Its unusual beat toys with your sense of speed, sometimes seeming to go faster.
I was trying for a rock piece, but as I don't listen to rock much, it's quite possible that I have no idea what I'm doing (^^; | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　なんか、分かりやすいタイトルです。分かりやすいことはいいことです。
　　メイドや女中というより小間使いって言ったほうが好き。
　　統計によると、大半の方がメイドと聞いただけで若い娘を思い浮かべて
　　しまうそうですが（何の統計？）、役に立つメイドさんは３、４０～です
　　よね。 | translation1 =For some reason, it's an easy title to understand. Easily understandable is a good thing.
Rather than saying maids or Jochuu, I prefer saying Komadukai.
Statistically speaking, most people think of a young woman when they hear "a maid".
(What statistic is that?), but an actually useful maid would probably be around 30~40. | note1 ="Jochuu" and "Komadukai" along with "maids" are different ways to women working for a house. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 Boss - [[Sakuya Izayoi]]'s theme | title =月時計　～ ルナ・ダイアル | roma =Tsukidokei ~ Runa daiaru | titleEN =Lunar Clock ~ Luna Dial | comment =十六夜　咲夜（いざよい・さくや）のテーマです。
メイドさんといえばハードロック（嘘）
かなりハードです。５面ということでこの位の激しさが必要だと

やっぱり誤解してるのかなぁ(^^; >ロック
私的詩的ロックということで | translation =Sakuya Izayoi's theme.
You can't have a maid without hard rock (j/k)
It's quite driving, fitting for the second-to-last stage.

...Guess I still don't know much about rock (^^;
Let's just call it 'private, poetical rock'. | note ='Private, poetical rock' (私的詩的ロック) is a reference to the 1997 Japanese murder mystery ''Jack the Poetical Private'' (詩的私的ジャック). Other mystery novels in the same series are likewise referenced throughout Sakuya's Spell Cards and design. | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　「黄泉津平坂、暗夜行路」（藤木稟）に出てくる時計です。
　　月時計というものがどういうものか知りたいものです(^^;
　　ハードなロック調なのはルナな部分。
　　あの小説で霊気琴という楽器が出てくるのですが、１，２年前ようやく
　　どういう楽器か分かりました(^^;
　　つーか、上流階級でも、明治時代の家にあるの？霊気琴（テル・ミン） | translation1 =The clock that appears in the novel "Yomizu hirasaka Yamiyo kouro" by Fujiki Rin.
I would like to know what kind of clock a lunar clock is. (^^;
The hard rock part is the lunar part.
There's an instrument called a Theremin in that novel, but I only found out about a year or two ago what that was. (^^;
Speaking of, would there even ''be'' a theremin in a Meiji era house? Even if it's an upper-class house? | note1 =The Theremin is an electrical instrument presented by the Russian inventor Leon Theremin. It senses the position of the performer's hand through electrostatic capacity and uses it to control its pitch and volume. The greatest charm of this instrument is its eerie sounds and the fact that it is played without any physical contact and physical feedback (save sound). }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 theme | title =ツェペシュの幼き末裔 | roma =Tsepeshu no osanaki matsuei | titleEN =The Young Descendant of Tepes | comment =最終面のテーマです。
最終面はいつもしっとりさせすぎていたので、今回は軽快なノリ
で。短いステージの、ただのつなぎの曲なので、あまり自己主張
させないような曲にしました。 | translation =Final stage theme.
The final stage themes have always been loaded, so I made it upbeat this time. As the final stage itself is quite short, I made this piece not as assertive. | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　ツェペシュとはブラド・ツェペシュのことです。
　　ドラキュラ公のモデルになった事で有名ですね。なんでも２万もの捕虜を
　　全員串刺しにして道に立てて並べたとか...
　　でもレミリアは末裔ではありません。 | translation1 =Tepes meaning Vlad Tepes.
He's famous for being the model of Count Dracula and impaling twenty thousand captives and stood them by the road...
However, Remilia isn't his descendant. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 Boss - [[Remilia Scarlet]]'s theme | title =亡き王女の為のセプテット | roma =Naki oujo no tame no seputetto | titleEN =Septette for a Dead Princess | comment =レミリア・スカーレットのテーマです。
これがラストだ！といわんばかりの曲を目指しました。
あんまり重厚さを出したり不気味さを出したり、そういうありが
ちラストは嫌なので、ジャズフュージョンチックにロリっぽさを
混ぜて．．．、ってそれじゃいつもとあんまり変わらんな。
このメロディは自分でも理解しやすく、気に入っています。 | translation =Remilia Scarlet's theme.
With this, I tried for a "This is the end!" feeling.
I didn't want it to be regal or ominous, which is normal for a final stage, so I made it Jazz-Fusion based with a hint of loli... wait, that's not any different than normal.
Its melody is easy for even me to get, so I like this song. | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　とあるクラシックの有名曲をもじってタイトルにしています。
　　その曲とは一切の関係もありません。
　　しかも曲はセプテットでもないです。雰囲気だけ（汗）
　　そもそも、誰も亡くなっていないし、王女ってだれ？ | translation1 =The title is a parody of a certain famous classic song's title.
It has nothing to do with that song though.
To top it off, the music isn't even a septette, only the feeling. (Sweats)
In the first place, nobody's dead and who's the princess? | note1 =The "certain famous classic song" to which ZUN is referring is Maurice Ravel's [[Wikipedia:Pavane_pour une infante défunte|Pavane pour une infante défunte]] (Pavane for a Dead Princess), which is translated into Japanese as {{lang|ja|「亡き王女の為のパヴァーヌ」}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage theme | title =魔法少女達の百年祭 | roma =Mahou shoujotachi no hyakunensai | titleEN =The Centennial Festival for Magical Girls | comment =エキストラステージのテーマです。
時折中華風です。時折ニューエイジ風です。それはなぜか？
何もテーマも考えずにキーボードを弾いてしまったら、こうなっ
てしまいました。
私の惰性の集大成見たいな曲です。よく聴くと、謎めいたフレー
ズが詰まっています。私のおもちゃ箱ですね。 | translation =Extra stage theme.
Sometimes it's Chinese, sometimes it's New Age. Why?
This is what happens after messing with my keyboard.
It's like an accumulation of my laziness. If you listen closely, there are many strange rhythms in this song. In other words, my toy-box. | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　百年に一度行われる収穫祭のようなものです。
　　何が収穫されるのでしょう（笑） | translation1 =Something like a harvest festival that's done every hundred years.
I wonder what's being harvested. (Laughs) }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage Boss - [[Flandre Scarlet]]'s theme | title ={{lang|en|U.N.}}オーエンは彼女なのか？ | roma =Yū enu ōen wa kanojo nano ka? | titleEN =U.N. Owen Was Her? |also ={{DiPP}}, {{SaBND|CD1}} | comment =フランドール・スカーレットのテーマです。
今回のもっともお気に入りです。いかにして悪魔っ娘を東洋風に
かつ、ミステリアスに表現できるかに挑戦した結果です。
ロリっぽいこのメロディは、今作品でもっとも私らしいメロディ
で、鍵盤弾くのが楽しかったです。 | translation =Flandre Scarlet's theme.
I liked this one the best out of the whole game. It depicts a devilish girl in an Oriental and mysterious way.
Loli-tastic melodies like this are what I'm best at, so I had a lot of fun composing this. | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　U.N.オーエン（ユナ・ナンシィ・オーエン）です。
　　分かる人だけ分かってください。元ネタはかなり古いです（７０年前くらい？）
　　なんで、この名前かっていうと、オーエンをアルファベット表記した方
　　で考えて、フランドールは「何者とも判らぬ者」とかけています。
　　フランドールの９枚目のスペルカードが、そのパロディになっています。 | translation1 =This is U.N. Owen (Una Nancy Owen).
Only people who understand it understand please. The original is quite old. (About 70 years ago?)
The reason why I name this is when thinking in terms of transcribing alphabet letters of Owen, it can be linked to Flandre who is an unknown being.
The ninth spell card is a parody of that. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Ending theme | title =紅より儚い永遠 | roma =Aka yori hakanai eien | titleEN =An Eternity More Transient than Scarlet | comment =エンディングのテーマです。
曲名から想像つくように、タイトル画面の曲の編曲みたいなもの
です。そのため和風です。
というか、和風で良いんですが。 | translation =Ending theme.
As you can guess from its name, this is an arranged version of the title theme. So it's also in a Japanese style.
Well, not that there's anything wrong with that. | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　タイトル曲の編曲みたいなもんなんで、曲名も同じような感じに。
　　いや別に紅って儚い感じはしないんだけどね(^^; | translation1 =The melody of this remix sounds similar to that of the title so its title gives a similar feeling.
Although scarlet doesn't really feel transient. (^^; }} {{MusicRoom | category =Staff Roll theme | title =紅楼　～ {{lang|en|Eastern Dream}}... | roma =Kourou | titleEN =Scarlet Tower ~ Eastern Dream... | comment =スタッフロールのテーマです。
いつもは絶望的に暗い曲ばっかのスタッフロールでしたが、今回
は希望的に明るくしました。多分。
相変わらずスタッフが少ないので、あまり長い曲には出来ません。
もっと壮大な曲でも良かったんですが、割とインルームな印象の
曲になりました。これは意図していません（笑） | translation =Staff Roll theme.
The staff roll has always been dark and desperate, so I made it a bit more happy and hopeful this time. I think.
As the staff list is always short, I couldn't write a long piece.
I could have made it more magnificent, but it ended up a little dry. That was not my intention (Laughs) | source1 =Afterword Shanghai Alice Correspondence vol. 1 | comment1 =　　そういえば、昔の私は、日本語　～ 英語　ってフォーマットで曲名
　　付けてたような...
　　それはともかく、スタッフロールは"なにがし{{lang|en|Dream}}"と付ける風習が
　　自分にはあるので、今回も(^^; | translation1 =Now that I think of it, I used to title songs in a Japanese ~ English format...
Anyways, it seems to be a custom of mine to put "whatever Dream" to staff roll themes, so once again.(^^; }} == Notes == {{Reflist}} == Also See == *[[List_by_Song/the Embodiment of Scarlet Devil|the Embodiment of Scarlet Devil arrangements listed by song]] == External links == *[https://www.shrinemaiden.org/forum/index.php/topic,18989.0.html ZUN's MIDI files played on a real SC-88Pro, including the original ''the Embodiment of Scarlet Devil'' MIDI soundtrack] {{Project Translations Notice}} {{Navbox EoSD}} [[de:Embodiment of Scarlet Devil/Musik]] [[es:Embodiment of Scarlet Devil/Música]] [[fr:Embodiment of Scarlet Devil/Musique]] [[pt:Embodiment of Scarlet Devil: Música]] [[ru:Embodiment of Scarlet Devil/Музыка]] [[zh:东方红魔乡/音乐]] [[Category:Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] [[Category:Music by Game]] [[Category:Translations]] {{DISPLAYTITLE:the Embodiment of Scarlet Devil/Music|noerror}}

revision.comment: /* Music List */ "Shuubun" would be autumn equinox.
revision.text:
==Music List== {{MusicRoom | category =Title Screen theme | title =泡沫の春　～ Tipping Scales | roma =Houmatsu no haru | titleEN =Ephemeral Spring ~ Tipping Scales | composer =ExPorygon | comment =いつもの「テーマ・オブ・イースタンストーリー」ですが、
内容に合わせて少しダークにしてみました。
結局東方なのでシリアスすぎるということにはならないと思いますが、
イメージは伝わるかと思います。 | translation =It's the so-called '[[Theme of Eastern Story]]', but not quite the same.
I wanted to create a darker tone than usual to fit the game.
It's still Touhou so nothing is TOO serious but I think the song
gives you a good feeling of what to expect. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 theme | title =ドリームサンライズ | roma =Dorīmu sanraizu | titleEN =Dream Sunrise | composer =ExPorygon
(original: ZUN) | comment =原曲よりもゆったりめのアレンジです。
まだ朝も早いので、朝起きて新しい一日が始まる
というイメージを出してみました。 | translation =It's slower and a bit more relaxed than the original.
It's still early in the morning, so I wanted to elicit the feeling
of just waking up to a brand new day. | note =Arrangement of "The Hall of Dreams' Great Mausoleum" from ''[[Ten Desires]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 Boss - [[Soga no Tojiko]]'s theme | title =目覚めし復讐の土壺 | roma =Mezameshi fukushuu no dotsubo | titleEN =Unfired Jar of Awakened Vengeance | composer =ExPorygon | comment =ドカン！と始まる曲です。稲妻だからね。
そして普段はガラの悪い屠自古も、今回は弱くて単純な１面ボスです。
この二つを組み合わせてしびれる１曲に仕立て上げました。
１面の割にショッキングすぎないといいのですが…。 | translation =This song starts with a bang! Because thunder sounds like that.
Isn't that a funny joke? Tojiko is ususally a threatening character,
but this time she's the lowly and simple stage 1 boss.
I tried to combine both of these facts into one electrifying song.
I hope it's not too shocking for the first boss. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 theme | title =枯れゆく木の葉の魂 | roma =Kareyuku konoha no tamashii | titleEN =Souls of the Dying Leaves | composer =Spectral Nexus | comment =枯れ葉が朽ち果て、生命が衰える秋ほど、哀愁を感じる季節もありません。
楽しい夏を奪い去っていく秋のイメージから、死別、憂鬱、
枯れ行く花の葬送曲とも言えるような雰囲気に仕立て上げました。
秋の鎖に繋がれ、血の赤色をした木の葉に覆われる…
なんと絶望的な運命なのでしょう。
でも逆に、ようやく涼しくなってきた訳で… | translation =There is no season as melancholy as fall, when dying leaves decay
into nonexistence, and life withers away at every glance.
Fall steals away the joys of summer, so I tried to give this theme
an atmosphere of bereavement and morosity, almost as if the
song itself were a funeral hymn for the dying flora.
Alas, what despair-inducing fate, fettered by the chains of autumn
that brings blood-red leaves falling to their mass graves...
But hey, look on the bright side, at least it finally gets cooler
around this time! | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 Boss - [[Shizuha Aki]]'s theme | title =嫌われ女神の伝説 | roma =Kiraware megami no densetsu | titleEN =Legend of the Unloved Goddess | composer =ExPorygon
(original: ZUN) | comment =原曲の激しさをうまく残せなかったので、
クライマックスに向けてゆっくりと盛り上げていく形になりました。
哀愁漂う感じになったので、
そこは静葉に合ってるんじゃないかなと思います。
いつも妹の影に隠れていて、毎年秋に木の葉を枯らしてしまうので、
本人が暗い感じになるのも無理は無いですね。
2面ボスの割に長い曲なのでアンコールスペルも
耐久にしました（テヘペロ）
| translation =After having difficulties capturing the intensity of the original,
I ended up instead making a slow buildup to a more powerful climax.
I believe it evokes a more melancholic feel, which fits
Shizuha rather well.
Always in the shadow of her sister and responsible for the annual
autumn withering, it's no wonder that she can be so gloomy.
It's quite long for stage 2 but that's why I made a timeout Encore Spell :p | note =Arrangement of "Angel's Legend" from ''[[Highly Responsive to Prayers]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 theme | title =イニシエーツアセント　～ 秋めく滝 | roma =Inishiētsu asento ~ Akimeku taki | titleEN =Initiate's Ascent ~ Autumnal Waterfall | composer =ExPorygon
(original: ZUN) | comment =原曲の「フォールオブフォール」によく似た感じですが、
文と椛は相変わらず仲が悪いようです。
こんな異変中なのに、どうも見覚えのある光景…あれ？滝は？
ここ妖怪の山じゃないじゃん！ | translation =It sounds pretty similar to the original "Autumnal Waterfall", but
Aya and Momiji still seem to be as untightly-knit as ever.
In spite of the incident, it all still seems so familiar - except the
waterfall. Wherever did that go?
Wait, this isn't Youkai Mountain. | note =Arrangement of "Fall of Fall ~ Autumnal Waterfall" from ''[[Mountain of Faith]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 Boss - [[Momiji Inubashiri]]'s theme | title =群れの心理　～ Order Versus Curiosity | roma =Mure no shinri | titleEN =Pack Mentality ~ Order Versus Curiosity | composer =ExPorygon
(original: senpi) | comment =有名な二次創作の椛のテーマを私なりにアレンジしてみました。
最終的に曲の最初と最後がかなり違うものになりましたが、
長いExtraやPhantasmボスよりも普通のステージに合ってるかなと思います。
原曲が残っている部分も完全に原曲通りではないのですが、
その方がいいのかなと思っています。 | translation =This is my take on Momiji's popular fan theme.
I aimed to not only add complexity but to also add my own touch.
It also ended up having a more distinct beginning and end,
which was rather fitting for a regular stage boss rather than
a longer Extra or Phantasm style boss.
Even during the traditional sections, it isn't an exact imitation
of the original but I think it's better that way. | note =Arrangement of [https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm9635592 "Awakened White Wolf's Instinct ~ awaking wolf's instinct"] from the fan-made ''[[Mountain of Faith]]'' Phantasm stage. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4 theme | title =花の戦旗の下に　～ Miasmatic Fragrance | roma =Hana no senki no shita ni | titleEN =Under the Flower Banner ~ Miasmatic Fragrance | composer =Popfan
(original: U2 Akiyama) | comment =ゲームの後半なので、何か暗い曲を作ってみました。
マーチングドラムというテーマがあったのですが、パーカッションを増やそうにも
リズムのためにボンゴしか増やせませんでした。
オリジナルではなくアレンジという事で、
後半は特に前半と違った感じにするのがとても難しかったです。
今でも追加されたメロディを聞くとびっくりしてしまいます。 | translation =Going into the second half of the game, I tried to make something dark.
Marching drums were a theme, too, but all I could really do with that
without outright killing the pace was add some bongos.
The second half in particular was a pain to differentiate from the first,
as this was an arrangement, rather than an original composition.
The new melody still manages to catch me off-guard every single time. | note =Arrangement of "Fragrant Plants" from ''[[Scarlet Weather Rhapsody]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4 Boss - [[Daiyousei]]'s theme | title =花持ちの行進　～ Fairy General | roma =Hanamochi no koushin | titleEN =The Flower Bearer's March ~ Fairy General | composer =ExPorygon
(original: ZUN) | comment =その名に違わず、精鋭妖精兵のリーダーとして現れた大妖精。
なので行進のイメージを入れてみました。
うまくいったかどうかはわかりませんが、
激しいアレンジになった事は間違いありません。
妖精大戦争、見逃されがちだけど楽しいよ。 | translation =To live up to her name, Daiyousei has become leader of an elite squad of
fairies. To complement that, I tried to invoke a feeling of marching in
this theme. I don't know if it really ended up working, but the end
result is still an intense arrangement of an often overlooked track from
a really fun stage. Fairy Wars is a pretty fun game. | note =Arrangement of "Loose Rain" from ''[[Fairy Wars]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 theme | title =伝染性権能中毒 | roma =Densensei kennou chuudoku | titleEN =The Contagious Addiction to Power | composer =Spectral Nexus | comment =森って迷ったり、動物に食べられたりするじゃないかって思って好きじゃないんです。
だから…この曲もこんなに暗い感じになってしまったんだと思います。
まあ、アップテンポで、かつ気味悪く、少し異世界に迷い込んでしまったような
感じを狙っていたので、出来は上々だと思います。
ですが、この曲を聴くといつも自分の森嫌いが蘇ってきます。
辛いなあ… | translation =I never really liked forests, I always would get scared that I'd get lost,
or get hunted by animals, and maybe that's why this came out so... minor.
Well, I tried to make this upbeat, but rather eerie at the same time and feel
'otherworldy' in some sense, so I'm quite satisfied at how this came out.
Unfortunately, my hatred for forests will always light up when
I hear this song. How sad... | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 Boss - [[Kisume]]'s theme | title =シールドイノセンス | roma =Shīrudo inosensu | titleEN =Sealed Innocence | composer =ExPorygon
(original: ZUN & [[はちみつくまさん|Hachimitsu Kuma-san]]) | comment =無関係な2曲を組み合わせた、本作の中で一番最初に作られた曲です。
1曲目は聞いての通り、そして2曲目は東方の迷宮スペシャルディスクからです。
作曲中、JynX氏のバージョンをリピート再生していたので、
インスピレーションにはJynX氏にも感謝しています。
本作中一番変更の多かった曲なので、気に入ってくれれば幸いです。 | translation =A combination of two unrelated pieces, this is actually the oldest track in
the game. While the first source is obvious, the second comes from
Labyrinth of Touhou's Special Disk. I can also thank JynX for inspiration -
I remember listening to his version on repeat while composing this.
This has probably undergone the most changes out of all of the tracks in
the game, so I really hope you like it! | note =Arrangement of "Cute Devil ~ Innocence" from ''[[Lotus Land Story]]'' and the [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AyrZR-WUsHs Bloodstained Seal theme] from ''[[Labyrinth of Touhou#東方の迷宮 Special Disc|Labyrinth of Touhou Special Disc]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 theme | title =春分　～ Perfect Sky | roma =Shunbun | titleEN =Spring Equinox ~ Perfect Sky | composer =ExPorygon
(original: ZUN) | comment =エキストララブにエキストララブ（もう少しの愛）が欲しかったのでこの選曲です。
比較的知名度の低い作品の道中曲を探していたのですが、
そこでラストステージにふさわしい、短く力強いエキストララブが選ばれました。
中ボス撃破辺りでループするように調整しましたが、
毎回うまくいくかはわかりません。
でもそんな心配をしている暇もありません。ラスボスも近いですからね。 | translation =For this theme, I decided Extra Love deserved some extra love.
I was looking for a stage theme from a relatively obscure game.
Extra Love ended up being the perfect choice.
It's short and intense enough to fit the final stage.
I aimed to get the song to loop right when the midboss is defeated.
I'm not sure if that always works, but there's no time to worry about it.
The final boss is near. Let's just get to the point. | note =Arrangement of "Extra Love" from ''[[Story of Eastern Wonderland]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 Boss - [[Lily White]]'s theme | title =花の都の戦い | roma =Hana no miyako no tatakai | titleEN =Battle at the Capital of Flowers | composer =Spaztique Explosive
(original: ZUN) | comment =この曲のアレンジにあたり、壮大でドラマチックなイメージを持たせるために、
MyonMyon様の東方夢終劇のサントラを大いに参考にさせて頂きました。
「天空の花の都」は前から好きな道中曲で、
それをドキドキもののボス戦曲にするいいチャンスでした。 | translation =For this theme, I took a lot of inspiration from MyonMyon's
soundtrack for Concealed the Conclusion. I wanted the song to have
that epic 'big dramatic finale' that CtC's boss fights had.
"Capital City of Flowers in the Sky" has always been my favorite stage theme,
and this was my chance to turn it into a heart-pounding boss theme. | note =Arrangement of "The Capital City of Flowers in the Sky" from ''[[Perfect Cherry Blossom]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 Boss - [[Lily White]]'s Encore Spell theme | title =大精帝の裁き　〜 Fateful Spring | roma =Daiseitei no sabaki | titleEN =Judgment of the Fairy Imperator ~ Fateful Spring | composer =ExPorygon
(original: ZUN) | comment =跪け！そして大精帝の裁きの弾幕を受けよ！
なぜこの曲なのかと疑問に思われている方もいるでしょうが、
理由はとても単純です。
昔、このゲームの企画中にSturmがリリーのラストスペルはこれにしよう、
「リリーブラック」の初登場は東方花映塚の映姫戦だからね！と提案したからです。
私も疑問に思わないままここまで来た訳です。
| translation =Repent! For the Fairy Imperator shall cast her danmaku justice down upon you!
I'm sure a lot of you are wondering why I chose this track to arrange.
The answer might be more simple than you think.
Eons ago, when the game was still in planning, Sturm suggested that Lily's
final theme could be this theme. Why? Because the first time "Lily Black"
appeared was during Eiki's stage in Phantasmagoria of Flower View.
I never ended up questioning it, so here we are!
| note =Arrangement of "Eastern Judgement in the Sixtieth Year ~ Fate of Sixty Years" from ''[[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage theme | title =魔法図書館の貴石苺　〜 Dionysus | roma =Mahou toshokan no kiseki ichigo | titleEN =The Enchanted Library's Malling Jewel"Malling jewel" is a name for the ''[[wikipedia:Rubus_idaeus|Rubus idaeus]]'' species of raspberry. ~ Dionysus | composer =ExPorygon
(original: ZUN) | comment =東方幻想郷の未使用曲です。過去の亡霊どころじゃないですね。
魔法図書館はMagic Shopにカウントしていいのでしょうか？
となるとRaspberryはどこにあるのでしょう？
とにかく、この曲では、何か古い曲に新しく切羽詰まった感じを加える事を目指しました。
いつもの図書館ですが、今回は緊急事態です。
それと、魔法少女達の千年祭のフレーズも少し入っています。
パチュリーもEx中ボスに慣れてきたのでしょうか？
まあ、もう一人は新しいのでよしとしましょうか。本の確保をお忘れなく。 | translation =An unused tune from Lotus Land Story. It's a real blast from the past.
Does the library double as a magic shop? I wonder where the raspberries are.
Regardless, I tried to bring something old back with a new sense of urgency.
You're back in the library again, but this time the situation is serious.
I also included a bit of The Centennial Festival for Magical Girls.
I wonder if Patchy is used to being the extra midboss?
At least the second one is someone new. Make sure to catalogue those books. | note =Arrangement of "Magic Shop of Raspberry", an unused track from ''[[Lotus Land Story]]'', as well as "The Centennial Festival for Magical Girls" from ''[[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage Boss - [[Koakuma]]'s event theme | title =悪魔との契約 | roma =Akuma to no Keiyaku | titleEN =Deal with a Devil | composer =ExPorygon | comment =会話専用という、他にない曲です。
テンポの遅い、邪悪で不安になる曲です。
あなたは悪魔の取引に乗りますか？悪くないような気もしますね。 | translation =As a song only for conversation, this theme is unlike any other.
Slow and sinister, it tries to evoke a feeling of unease.
Would you be tempted by the devil's offer? It sounds like a good deal. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage Boss - [[Koakuma]]'s theme | title =シニスターセレモニー　～ 悪魔との舞踏 | roma =Shinisutā seremonī ~ Akuma to no buyou | titleEN =Sinister Ceremony ~ Dance with a Devil | composer =ExPorygon | comment =N/A | translation =This song is mostly original. Besides my own ideas, there's also
some influence from [[Fantastic Danmaku Festival]]'s [[Fantastic_Danmaku_Festival/Music#Stage_4_Boss_-_Koakuma.27s_Theme|"The Little Devil Dance"]].
I wanted this song to feel sinister, even if Koa isn't really evil.
She's just corrupted by the incident, same as the others.
I hope the song's intermission reflects this. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage Boss - [[Koakuma]]'s second theme | title =邪なるソロモンの継承者 | roma =Yokoshima naru soromon no keishousha | titleEN =Wicked Solomon's Successor | composer =ExPorygon | comment =この曲は実験的な要素がとても強く、本作の中でもかなりユニークな曲になっています。
一番の難題は曲の方向性でした。エレクトロ系の曲は初めてで、初期のバージョンは
小悪魔のテーマその１の熱さを越えられず、オーケストラ寄りに作り直そうとも考えた程です。
ボーカルに集中しようと提案してくれたPopfanさんには感謝してもしきれません。
結果的に私の普段のスタイルに戻ってきましたが、そのおかげで他の曲との違和感を抑えながらも
力強さ、クライマックス感を出す事ができました。まさか自分がここまでの物を作れるとはと、
我ながらびっくりしています。本作どころか、いままで自分が作ってきた中で
一番のお気に入りです。 | translation =I really wanted to experiment with this one. As a result, it ended up being my
most unique track in the game. The biggest challenge with this one was
deciding which direction to take the song in. This my first time trying
something mostly electronic, and a lot of early iterations were less intense
than Koa's first theme. At one point I almost scrapped what I had to try to
focus on making it more traditionally orchestral. I have to thank Popfan for
suggesting that I focus on the most unique aspect of the song: the vocals.
I do switch back to my more usual style by the end. It keeps the song from
sounding too out of place and serves to give the end a stronger, more
climactic effect. I'm honestly shocked by the end result and never would have
imagined it quite like it is. This is not only my favorite track from the
game, but my favorite out of all the tracks I've ever made. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Ending theme | title =帰路は枯れ藤に覆われて | roma =Kiro wa karefuji ni oowarete | titleEN =The Walk Home Is Paved in Wilted Wisteria | composer =ExPorygon | comment =エンディングというのは、勝利に浸るようなもの、
心温まるもの、悲劇的なものなど、種類はいろいろな物があります。
この曲はほろ苦い感じを意識しました。
結局皆が欲しい者を手に入れられた訳ではありませんから。
ちなみに、「花は幻想のままに」の影響を強く受けています。 | translation =Endings can be many things. They can be trimuphant, heartwarming, or tragic.
I designed this theme to go along with a bittersweet ending.
After all, not everyone gets what they wanted in the end.
By the way, "The Flowers Remain in Fantasy" was a big inspiration for this. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Credits theme | title =泡沫の花畑 | roma =Houmatsu no hanabatake | titleEN =Garden of Ephemeral Flowers | composer =ExPorygon
(original: ZUN) | comment =「過去の花」に特別思い入れはないのですが、ここで使うべきだと思いました。
原曲は忘れられた曲の一つです。リリーホワイトの登場する東方妖々夢の４面のテーマに
]なるはずだった曲と言う人もいるので、正式なテーマと組み合わせてみました。
今回は優雅で不思議な感じの音を使っています。
花園を漂うようにゆったりと…
| translation =I never liked "Fairy of Flower" much, but it felt appropriate to use here.
It's one of those forgotten themes. Some people theorize
that it's actually Lily White's stage theme from Perfect Cherry Blossom.
I compromised by combining this one with her actual theme.
This time, I used a particularly ethereal set of sounds.
Relax as you drift through the garden. | note =Arrangement of "The Capital City of Flowers in the Sky" from ''[[Perfect Cherry Blossom]]'' as well as "Flower of Past Days ~ Fairy of Flower", an unused track from the same game. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Score theme | title =プレイヤーズスコア | roma =Pureiyāzu sukoa | titleEN =Player's Score | composer =Kappatalist
(original: ZUN) | comment =いつも通り、相変わらずのプレイヤーズスコアです。
ですが、幻想郷は異変で調子がおかしいので、
死んだ時の曲も外した感じにしてみました。
いやー、この曲を作ったのはずいぶん前で、今ようやくコメントを書いてるんですね！
えっと、何言えばいいかな……うーん、洞窟いいよね？ | translation =It's the same old Player's Score you know, as it always will be.
However, with the whole realm of Gensokyo so off-kilter as a result
of the incident, I figured that death itself should sound equally "off".
Gosh, I made this so long ago and I'm just writing commentary now!
What to say, what to say... hmm. Caves are just wonderful, aren't they? | note =Arrangement of "Player's Score", a recurring theme originating from ''[[Mountain of Faith]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Event theme | title =論争する幻想 | roma =Ronsou suru gensou | titleEN =Disputed Fantasy | composer =ExPorygon
(original: U2 Akiyama) | comment =東方逆妙乱は日の目の当たらないキャラに
スポットライトを当てるのがテーマです。ただし霖之助を除く。
本作に出られただけ喜ぶべきでしょうか？
初期案では霖之助の役回りはもっと小さいものでした。
霖之助に何かしてあげた方がいい気がしてきました。
もしかしたらまた今度…？ | translation =EUB is supposed to shine the spotlight on obscure characters.
Unless you're Rinnosuke. Then it fires lasers at you.
Still, perhaps he should be happy to be in the game at all?
His role was very limited in our original plan.
I feel like we could do more for Rinnosuke. Maybe in the future? | note =Arrangement of "Argue for and Against" from ''[[Scarlet Weather Rhapsody]]''. }} {{MusicRoom | category =(Unused) Extra Stage Boss - [[Koakuma]]'s theme | title =ライチャスストラグル　〜 悪魔との決闘 | roma =Raichasu sutoraguru ~ akuma to no kettou | titleEN =Righteous Struggle ~ Duel with a Devil | composer =ExPorygon
(original: ZUN) | comment =元々小悪魔のテーマとして、ZUN氏の曲の中でも最も知名度が低いであろう、
トルテルマジックからの一曲で盛大に締めようと考えていました。
最初は後半のテーマだけダークな感じにしてもいいかなと思っていたのですが、
最終的にこの２曲を並べると違和感があったので、お蔵入りとなりました。
このゲームのために作った曲としては2曲目ですが、出来には満足しています。
| translation =This was supposed to be Koakuma's theme. It was to be a grandiose finale using
one of the most obscure tracks ZUN has ever created, from Torte Le Magic.
Eventually, I decided that a more sinister theme would be better for her.
At first I was fine with having her second theme be the sinister one, but
ultimately decided that the juxtaposition of the two themes would be jarring.
This was probably only the second theme I made for the game,
but I'm happy with how this arrangement came out.
| note =Arrangement of "Sacred Battle" from ''[[Torte Le Magic]]''. }} {{Navbox EUB}} [[Category:Music by Game]]

==Music List== {{MusicRoom | category =Title Screen theme | title =目覚めの歌 | roma =Mezame no uta | titleEN =Morning Song | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =タイトル画面のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

東方原作っぽさとスマホRPGっぽさという、このゲームの構成要素2つを表現した曲です。
本当はモーニングミュージックみたいにしたかったんですが、それもやるとさすがに上記2つの風味が損なわれるので諦めました。
でも、スマホゲームのメニュー画面の曲も、ある意味「朝起きたときに聴く曲」の一種なのかも？ | translation =Title theme. An original piece for this game.

As the game is a fusion of Touhou official games and mobile RPGs, this song aims to express such feelings that could cover both genres.
Initially, I wanted to make it like arcade title music （we call it "morning music" in Japanese）, but it's too stretched away from the impressions of those two genres combined, and that was the end of it.
But the menu music from mobile games, in some sense, is also the music that one listens in the morning, isn't it? }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 Theme | title =地図の上の冒険 | roma =Chizu no ue no bouken | titleEN =An Adventure on the Map | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =1面のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

楽器の効果で東方っぽくなっていますが、それを除けば、いつもの自分がよく作る雰囲気の曲です。
なんか一瞬唐突に騒がしくなりますが、STGってこうなる曲が結構ありますよね。
映画音楽の要素を取り入れた結果そういう風潮ができたという噂です。本当？ | translation =Stage 1 theme. An original piece for this game.

It sounds Touhou-esque thanks to the instruments, but except that it's mostly my own style with my usual atmosphere.
It may sound like it's going noisy all of a sudden, but shmups generally do that from my experience.
I heard it's initially inspired by movie music, then everyone started doing so, and it became a trend. I don't know if that's true, though. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 Boss - Mimi Kuroudo's Theme | title =神々の読み合った紙々 | roma =Kamigami no yomi atta kamigami | titleEN =Love Letters in the Mind Game | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =蔵人 未見のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

題材が文車妖妃なので、郵便屋みたいな曲にすることにしました。
短い曲でキャラクターを表現するのって毎回どうすればいいか悩むんですが、
いざ作ってみるとしっくりきちゃうんですよねー。短いぶん脳内で補完が効きやすいんでしょうか。 | translation =Kuroudo Mimi's theme. An original piece for this game.

The character was a youkai inspired by "Fuguruma-yohi," which was a female youkai who's born from a vehicle designed to deliver books, so I made the song so that it gives a feeling of a delivery driver.
It's always annoying for me to write a short song that has to show a character, but when I started composing it, I actually finished them quickly enough that I didn't feel the annoyance.
I guess it's so short that it's easier to finish on my mind. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 Theme | title =ピアトゥユートピア | roma =Pia tu yūtopia | titleEN =Peer 2 UtopiaA pun on [[wikipedia:Peer-to-peer|P2P networking]]. | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =2面のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

人間も妖怪も問わずにゲームの対戦が行われている場面の描写です。
オーソドックスに東方らしい曲にしようと思ったので、私が花映塚を初プレイした頃に考えついたメロディを引っ張り出して今風に仕立てました。
実に10年以上越しのアウトプットです。 | translation =Stage 2 theme. An original piece for this game.

A song that portrays the scene where humans and youkai are playing games against each other without caring about races.
I wanted to make it sound like an orthodoxical Touhou theme, so I recalled the melody on my mind when I played PoFV for the first time, and I remastered it with my current style. It's actually been 10 years since that. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 Boss - Shounen Hiraga's Theme | title =丑の日は撃ち返しを食らえ{{Nihongo||撃ち返し|uchigaeshi}} is a STG term for bullets released by enemies when destroyed, also known as "suicide bullets". | roma =Ushi no hi wa uchigaeshi o kurae | titleEN =Bite the Bullet from the Midsummer Heat! | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =平賀 生然のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

出落ち！！ 以外の何物でもないですね。
東方を真似した音楽という形式の中で、さらに東方キャラを真似しているキャラを表現しています。ややこしい！
ちなみにヌルヌルしたシンセの音色にはそのものズバリElectric Eelという名前がついています。 | translation =Hiraga Shounen's theme. An original piece for this game.

You should've heard [[Undefined_Fantastic_Object/Music#Stage_6_Boss_-_Byakuren_Hijiri's_theme|that punchline]] right when you listened to it! Yes, it's intended.
First, this is a song that mimics Touhou's original music. Then, I have to make it express an original character that mimics [[Byakuren Hijiri|a Touhou character]]. It gets confusing quickly!
By the way, the instrument for that slippery fishy sound was accurately named "Electric Eel."Referring to the custom of eating eel during midsummer to stave off the heat, supposedly started during the Edo period. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 Theme | title =小さなカレイドスクリーンに触れて | roma =Chiisana kareidosukurīn ni furete | titleEN =Touching on Your Small Kaleidoscreen | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =3面のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

3面なのに新たなる旅立ち～って感じがする曲ですが、きっと気のせいです。
幻想郷じゅうの目印を巡る様子が1ステージにまとめられています。贅沢！
季節の関係上、花畑は雪に埋もれていますが、主人公たちの目には幻の景色が映っています | translation =Stage 3 theme. An original piece for this game.

We're only at the 3rd stage, but the song feels like we're starting a "new journey." I think it's just me, though.
I included everyone that was looking for marks all over the Gensokyo in this single song. How luxurious!
Although flower fields are covered in snow due to the season, illusions of such landscape are showing in the protagonists' perspective. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 Boss - Yukari Yakumo's Theme | title =バイナリィスフィア | roma =Bainaryi sufia | titleEN =Binary Spheres | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =八雲 紫のテーマです。東方三月精『二つの世界』のアレンジ楽曲です。

原曲は書籍CDの収録曲ですが、最近のゲーム収録曲っぽくアレンジしてみました。
紺珠伝や天空璋のあの曲やあの曲を彷彿としていただければ幸いです。
ところで今作の1～3面のボスはもちろんラスボスの元ネタへの伏線になっています。君はわかったかな？ | translation =Yakumo Yukari's theme. An arrangement of "Two World" from [[Strange_and_Bright_Nature_Deity_3_(CD)|Strange and Bright Nature Deity 3]].

Although the original music was from a book CD, I rearranged it in the current game style, so it sounds like a modern game background music.
I also had two songs from LoLK and HSiFS on my mind when I composed it. If this song reminded you of those two original pieces, I'd feel honored.
Fun fact: 1-3 stage bosses all have hints pointing to the original reference of the hidden boss. Have you figured it out yet? }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4 Theme | title =変わり続ける不変の景色 | roma =Kawari tsuzukeru fuhen no keshiki | titleEN =Inconstant and Unchanging Sights | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =4面のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

進んでも進んでも同じ風景なのに、なぜか主人公はちゃんと進んでいる自覚があるという場面です。
音楽的な意味でも「王道しか進行しない」という、原作にはありえないほど単純明快な曲ですね。
駆け出しDTMerの耳コピ練習曲にもオススメの一曲です。 | translation =Stage 4 theme. An original piece for this game.

The landscape here never changes no matter how much you move forward, yet for some reason,
the protagonists could realize that they are advancing. This is the scene I'm trying to convey with the song.
It's like a textbook song that is simple and clear, which is nothing similar to the original Touhou songs.
If you happened to be new to digital composing, this might be a good song to practice ear-transcribes with.
}} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4 Boss - Sasuta no Izuhime's Theme | title =少女の秘密のエピグラム | roma =Shoujo no himitsu no epiguramu | titleEN =Girl's Secret Epigram | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =刺田 厳姫のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

いわゆるあの“八咫烏のリズム”をノリノリでフィーチャーした曲です。
記紀の要素に忠実に考えたはずの厳姫が、まさかここまではっちゃけたキャラになるとは……。
まあ、元ネタからして、基本的に男として描かれるのに紛れもなく“巫女になった”というエピソードがある人物ですからね。 | translation =Sasuta no Izuhime's theme. An original piece for this game.

It's a song featuring all the Yatagarasu rhythms (Okuu's and Kanako's themes). That's about it.
Although her character design was supposed to follow Kojiki and Nihon Shoki with all seriousness, she ended up being such a casual, vivacious character after all.
But judging through her original reference, Michi no Omi no Mikoto, who had the complex where they were portrayed as a masculine figure yet received a feminine title, she probably deserves such a contrary. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 Theme | title =玉つ嶋水上都市 | roma =Tamatsushima suijou toshi | titleEN =Tamatsushima Floating City | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =5面のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

いかにも幽霊や亡霊のキャラが出てきそう～な曲に仕上がって満足しています。
山吹の都にたくさん浮かんでいる「和歌という珠」ですが、1つ1つが地珠の中身をスキャンする装置になっています。
本来は意思あるものを入れられる設計じゃなかったせいか、内側から壊されまくってるようですね。 | translation =Stage 5 theme. An original piece for this game.

It's a song that will give you a feel where all kinds of ghosts and spirits will probably come out. I'm delighted with such a result.
The special orbs that appear inside the City of Kerria are scanning devices that examine contents from every single Map Orb.
But their design was flawed that they don't allow objects with wills to get in, and they were torn apart within as a result. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 Boss - Mariko Sengakuji's Theme | title =偏執の朱筆　～ Fanatic Monograph | roma =Henshuu no shuhitsu ~ Fanatic Monograph | titleEN =Red-pencil of Fixation ~ Fanatic Monograph | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =仙覚寺 鞠子のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

これ絶対さっきのしっとりした曲の次に流れちゃダメなやつでしょ！！
脚注を足すかのように合いの手が入ったり、同じフレーズが別の調で強引に再解釈されたりするふざけた曲です。
とにかく「しまった！ やべー奴に絡まれた！」感が出てたら幸いです。 | translation =Sengakuji Mariko's theme. An original piece for this game.

I'm telling you this song absolutely doesn't sound like the one that plays right after the stage 5 theme.
This is a messy song which contains interjections like adding footnotes, and modulations like misinterpreting previous melody.
Anyway, I'd be honored if you felt that you accidentally crashed into the weirdest weirdo for the century. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 Theme | title =鳳凰鳴けり多賀城陵に | roma =Houou nakeri takaki-oka ni | titleEN =A Phoenix Cried on the High Hill | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =6面のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

鳳凰が鳴く所といえば？ そう、高岡ですね！
富山県高岡市にある鳳鳴橋は、その地名の由来を再現して、両脇に一対の鳳凰像が並んでいることで有名です。
きっと、千保川を渡る人々を見守ったり、究極進化した氷見うどんを左下から見守ったりしているんでしょう。 | translation =Stage 6 theme. An original piece for this game.

The Japanese idiom says, name a place where the phoenix chirps? Takaoka, it is!
The "Homei Bridge" (literally Bridge of Chirping Phoenix) in Takaoka city is famous for having a pair of phoenix statues at each side of the bridge. Takaoka city's name came from an ancient text that said,
"Houou-nakeri-ka-no-takaki-oka-ni." (literally, phoenix chirps on his high hill.)
And the statues were built to respect the city's origin. I'm sure the phoenix is still watching over the people who are crossing the Senbo River, sitting at the bottom-left corner, blessing the ultimately evolved Himi Udon. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 Boss - Otomo no Kazuha's Theme | title =幻想万華集万華集 is a portmanteau of 万華鏡 (kaleidoscope) and 万葉集 ([[wikipedia:Man'yōshū|Man'yōshū]]).　～ Anthologia | roma =Gensou bankashuu | titleEN =Fantastic Kaleidoscape ~ Anthologia | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =大伴 家珠葉のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

花の話をするときって、生き物としてよりも、図柄や記号としての方がよく扱われますよね。
植物という実体から抜け出て、記号そのものになろうとするバーチャルな存在、それが花なのかもしれません。
古今東西、文学の題材にしやすすぎるのも、そのせいなんでしょう。
その度合いなら「人間」の方が上ですけどね。 | translation =Otomo no Kazuha's theme. An original piece for this game.

When we talk about flowers, we usually see them as patterns or symbols instead of organisms.
So if we only take out the abstract symbol from the flower without its concrete body, we can still call this virtual being as "flower."
Ever since ancient times, regardless of Westerns or Easterns, it's ridiculous how convenient it's been to use flowers as a theme for literature. And I suppose that was the reason all along.
But to that extent, "humans" should still be superior to flowers in terms of themes. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 Boss - Otomo no Kazuha's Last Spell Theme | title =テーマ・オブ・＊＊＊＊＊ストーリー | roma =Tēma obu ***** sutōrī | titleEN =Theme of ******* Story | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =ファイナルスペルのテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

妖々夢を元祖とし、今や東方二次創作でも定番と化したこの演出ですが、
せっかく和歌集が題材なので、ひと工夫入れてみました。
……幻想郷の妖精に自我を乗っ取られかけるって、ちょっとしたホラーでは？ | translation =Final Spell's theme. An original piece for this game.

The standard presentation that's adapted by both official games and fan games ever since PCB.
And since Waka collection is the theme, I put a lot more effort into this one.
... Isn't it kind of horrifying that Gensokyo's fairies can completely override your will? }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage Theme | title =Go behind the scene!　～ 閉領域のゲーム | roma =Heiryouiki no gēmu | titleEN =Go behind the scene! ~ the Game in the Closed Region | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =エキストラステージのテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

何風とか全く意識せずに好き放題作りました。東方風要素は全て後付けです。
と言いつつ、それもそれで『魔法少女たちの百年祭』とかのリスペクトなんですけどね。 | translation =Extra stage theme. An original piece for this game.

I didn't care about styles at all for this one, and I just composed it all by my instincts. Touhou elements were added after I finished the main melody.
But after all, every bit of this song was inspired by "The Centennial Festival for Magical Girls" here and there. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage Boss - Meme Nokiba's Theme | title =ドットマトリクスバトラーズ | roma =Dotto matorikusu batorāzu | titleEN =Dot Matrix Battlers | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =軒端 目々のテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

この世には『囲碁EP』という同人音楽CDがあるのですが、
その時期は生活が慌ただしかったので、参加はおろか、東京まで買いにすら行けませんでした。
あれからずっと、何とかして手に入れたいと思いつづけています。 | translation =Nokiba Mémé's theme. An original piece for this game.

There used to be a doujin album named "I-Go EP" （Lit. Go EP） in the world.
During that time, my life was simply too busy, and I didn't have time to attend the event, not even enough time for me to go to Tokyo to buy it later.
I still want to get that album any way I can someday after all this time. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Ending Theme | title =今日降る弾の、いや重け吉事A reference to the last poem in the [[wikipedia:Man'yōshū|Man'yōshū]], written by Ōtomo no Yakamochi ("新しき　年の初めの　初春の　'''今日降る雪の　いやしけ吉事'''"), wishing for good fortune to pile up like snow on New Year's Day. | roma =Kyou furu dan no, iya shi ke yogoto | titleEN =May You Be Happier and Happier, with the Today's Danmaku | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =エンディングのテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

「今日の雪景色……ではなく弾幕景色のごとく、ますます君に幸せが降り注ぎますように」
というような題名です。
でもそれって弾数が多いほどハッピーってことでしょうか。
それはちょっと危ない方の幸せな気がする。そういうのってなんて言ったっけ？ | translation =Ending theme. An original piece for this game.

"I wish your life will be filled with happiness, just like how snows... no, danmaku are filling this landscape today.”
If the title of the song could speak, that's what it would say.
But will one really be happy about that they're getting more bullets in their life?
It's happiness that comes with dangers, I guess. What was the word for this again? }} {{MusicRoom | category =Staff Roll Theme | title =歌枕では初夢を見る | roma =Utamakura de wa hatsuyume o miru | titleEN =In New Year She Sings, in First Dream She Yearns | composer =Hade Kurai | comment =スタッフロールのテーマです。本作オリジナルの楽曲です。

1面や3面の曲を賑やかにしたものです。
雰囲気だけでも、長い旅路を振り返るような気分を感じていただければ幸いです。 | translation =Staff roll theme. An original piece for this game.

The more glamorized version of stage 1 and stage 3 alike.
I hope this gives the feel of finally finishing a long journey. }} ==Notes== {{smallrefs}} {{Navbox FmVA}} [[Category:Music by Game]]

==Music List== {{MusicRoom |category =Title screen |title =常世之乡 |roma =Chángshì zhī xiāng |titleEN =Land of Tokoyo <ref>'[[wikipedia:ja:常世の国|Tokoyo]]' (常世) - the unaging realm of the afterlife in Japanese mythology</ref> |comment =久违的标题曲依旧包含着令人怀念的旋律，同时与前作标题曲存在着紧密的联系
好好欣赏这梦幻倒影中的常世之乡吧！ |translation =The long-awaited title theme, as always, has the nostalgic melody in it, but at the same time has a close relationship to the previous work's title theme.
Appreciate well the Land of Tokoyo reflected in this fantasy dream! }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 1 Theme |title =无穷无尽的白色 |roma =Wúqióngwújìn de báisè |titleEN =Endless White |comment =这首曲子有一种奇妙的延伸感，仿佛就要看见茫茫无际的雪原一样
同时也有一种怀旧感，希望你能感受到重新回归的喜悦 |translation =This track has a strange feeling of reaching out, as if you can see a limitless field of snow.
At the same time there's also a feeling of nostalgia, I hope you can feel the joy of returning once more. }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 1 Boss - Hyp's Theme |title =梦境演剧 |roma =Mèngjìng yǎnjù |titleEN =Dreamland Drama |comment =在寒冷的空中遇见了一位陌生人，羽毛与白雪共舞，不知不觉让人困倦……
中间的三拍子像不像在催眠？ |translation =In the frigid sky we meet a stranger, whose feathers dance amidst the snow, unknowingly making people sleepy.
Does the 3/4 time in the middle sound like hypnosis? }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 2 Theme |title =迷途之家的野猫 |roma =Mítúzhījiā de yěmāo |titleEN =Wild Cat of Mayohiga |comment =原曲：遠野幻想物語
“来到这个地方，我就觉得浑身不自在。时不时还听见诡异的声音……”
包含着有趣的细节的一首曲子，仔细聆听一下吧 |translation =Original Track: [[Perfect_Cherry_Blossom/Music#Stage_2_theme|The Fantastic Tales from Tono]]
"I've felt uncomfortable since coming here. And occasionally I hear strange noises......"
A track with many interesting details, please listen carefully }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 2 Boss - Chen's Theme |title =橙 |roma =Chéng |titleEN =Chen |comment =原曲：ティアオイエツォン(withered leaf)
如果听过原曲，是不是有点惊讶？这是属于橙的旋律
这首曲子让人充满了战斗的欲望！ |translation =Original Track: [[Perfect_Cherry_Blossom/Music#Stage_2_Boss_-_Chen.27s_theme|Diao Ye Zong (withered leaf)]]
If you've listened to the original, are you a bit surprised? This melody belongs to Chen.
This track fills one up with the desire to fight! }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 3 Theme |title =喜欢西洋乐的人偶们 |roma =Xǐhuān xīyángyuè de rén'ǒu men |titleEN =The Dolls That Like Western Music |comment =原曲：ブクレシュティの人形師
曲风突然有了变化，这也是首次尝试加入一些即兴的元素
不知道可爱的人偶们都喜欢什么样的音乐呢，但想必有喜欢西洋乐的吧 |translation =Original Track: [[Perfect_Cherry_Blossom/Music#Stage_3_theme|The Doll Maker of Bucuresti]]
The musical style has suddenly changed, this is the first time I tried adding in elements of improvisation.
I don't know what kind of music the cute dolls like, but it probably includes Western music }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 3 Boss - Alice Margatroid's Theme |title =看不破的人偶剧 |roma =Kànbùpò de rén'ǒu jù |titleEN =Intricate Doll Theater |comment =原曲：人形裁判 ～ 人の形弄びし少女
这首曲子具有独特的异国风情，配合着人偶的演出，感觉十分有趣 |translation =Original Track: [[Perfect_Cherry_Blossom/Music#Stage_3_Boss_-_Alice_Margatroid.27s_theme|Doll Judgement ~ The Girl Who Played with People's Shapes]]
This track has a unique flair of a foreign country. Accompanied by the dolls' performance, it's a very interesting feeling. }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 4 Theme |title =春岚 |roma =Chūn lán |titleEN =Spring Mountain Mist |comment =这是一首非常特别的曲子，不如说是配乐了
当看见樱花轨迹汇聚到一起的时候，你是否感觉到了震撼呢 |translation =This is a very special kind of track, you could almost call it a musical score.
When you see the cherry blossom tracks gather together, do you feel a sense of awe? }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 4 Boss - Lily White's Theme |title =云霄之上花与舞 |roma =Yúnxiāo zhī shàng huā yǔ wǔ |titleEN =Flowers and Dancing Above the Heavens |comment =原曲：天空の花の都
同样是原作中没有立绘的人物，于是进行了大胆的改编
中间的华尔兹真是让人陶醉 |translation =Original Track: [[Perfect_Cherry_Blossom/Music#Stage_4_theme|The Capital City of Flowers in the Sky]]
She's also someone who didn't have a portrait in the original, so I made some daring edits.
The waltz in the middle is rather intoxicating }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 5 Theme |title =通向往生之界的阶梯 |roma =Tōng xiàng wǎngshēng zhī jiè de jiētī |titleEN =Stairs Leading Toward the Afterlife |comment =原曲：東方妖々夢 ～ Ancient Temple
作为原作中极具代表性的旋律，改编自然也不能示弱
使用了不少和风乐器，同时也在努力表现出森严感 |translation =Original Track: [[Perfect_Cherry_Blossom/Music#Stage_5_theme|Eastern Ghostly Dream ~ Ancient Temple]]
As a representative track of the original work, I can't show weakness in any changes I make.
Quite a few Japanese style instruments were used, and at the same time I worked hard to express a feeling of solemnness }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 5 Boss - Ran Yakumo's Theme |title =极乐庄严 |roma =Jílè zhuāngyán |titleEN =Paradise Solemn |comment =原曲：妖々跋扈 ～ Who done it!
与原曲完全不一样的风格，体现着宗教的神圣和威严
值得一提的是，曲名来自于佛教用语 |translation =Original Track: [[Perfect_Cherry_Blossom/Music#Phantasm_Stage_theme|Spiritual Domination ~ Who done it!]]
A completely different style from the original, expressing the godliness and majesty of religion.
Worth mentioning is, the title comes from a phrase in Buddhism }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 6 Theme |title =狂樱之舞 |roma =Kuángyīng zhī wǔ |titleEN =Dance of the Crazed Sakura |comment =充满了庆典的欢乐和祥和，然而这却是冥界之中
明明是樱花盛开之时，却让人感觉到了异样和不安 |translation =A celebration full of happiness and auspiciousness, but it's in the Netherworld.
Even though the cherry blossoms are blooming, one gets a feeling of uneasiness. }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 6 Boss - Yuyuko Saigyouji's Theme |title =生死之间花吹雪 |roma =Shēngsǐ zhī jiān huā chuīxuě |titleEN =Storm of Flower Petals Between Life and Death |comment =原曲：幽雅に咲かせ、墨染の桜 ～ Border of Life
这是一次全新的尝试，灵感来自于那些融合了和风和流行摇滚的乐队
这首曲子并没有加入原曲中的经典旋律，好戏要留在后头！ |translation =Original Track: [[Perfect_Cherry_Blossom/Music#Stage_6_Boss_-_Yuyuko_Saigyouji.27s_theme|Bloom Nobly, Ink-Black Cherry Blossom ~ Border of Life]]
This is an all-new experiment, the inspiration is that one band that mixes Japanese with rock and roll.
This track doesn't include the classical melody from the original, the best is left for last! }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Stage 6 Boss - Yuyuko Saigyouji's Second Theme |title =飞舞吧！永世的繁花 |roma =Fēiwǔ ba! Yǒngshì de fánhuā |titleEN =Dance! Elegant Flower of Eternity |comment =原曲：ボーダーオブライフ
终于，那个熟悉的旋律出现了！
这首曲子从经典旋律开始，在最后重新回到新的主题，意味深刻 |translation =Original Track: [[Perfect_Cherry_Blossom/Music#Stage_6_Boss_-_Yuyuko_Saigyouji.27s_second_theme|Border of Life]]
Finally, the familiar melody appears!
This track starts with the classical melody, and at the end returns to the new theme, how deep. }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Staff Roll Theme |title =幕华祭 ~ 春雪篇 ~ |roma =Mùhuájì ~ chūnxuěpiān ~ |titleEN =Fantastic Danmaku Festival ~ Spring Snow Incident ~ |comment =经历了一场宛如梦境的旅行之后，是不是有点意犹未尽呢？
这首曲子重新改编了幕华祭的主题旋律，让你有熟悉而又陌生的感觉 |translation =After a dreamlike journey, is there still a feeling of wishing to continue on?
This track is a remix of Fantastic Danmaku Festival's main theme, in order to give you a feeling of both familiarity and unfamiliarity. }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Extra Stage Theme |title =感知崩坏的空间 |roma =Gǎnzhī bēnghuài de kōngjiān |titleEN =Space Where Awareness Crumbles |comment =一首充满神秘感的曲子，毕竟是身处一个如此诡异的地方
为了营造这种感觉而使用了合成器，果然电子乐不简单啊 |translation =A track full of mysteriousness, since we're in such a mysterious place.
In order to create this feeling I used a synthesizer. As I thought, electronic music isn't simple. }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Extra Stage Boss - Yukari Yakumo's Theme |title =人类与妖怪的铁幕 |roma =Rénlèi yǔ yāoguài de tiěmù |titleEN =Iron Curtain of Human and Youkai |comment =原曲：憑坐は夢と現の間に ～ Necro-Fantasia
改编自八云紫的主题曲之一，这次体现出了不一样的风格
伴随着充满了克苏鲁元素的弹幕，是否让你渐渐丧失理智了呢 |translation =Original Track: [[Antinomy_of_Common_Flowers/Music#Yukari_Yakumo.27s_2nd_theme.2C_Shrine_During_Incident_theme|Yorimashi Between Dreams and Reality ~ Necro-Fantasia]]
Remixed from one of Yukari Yakumo's themes, this time demonstrating a different style
Along with the danmaku filled with "Cthulhu" elements, have they made you gradually lose your sanity? }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Phantasm Stage Theme |title =月下花见急行 |roma =Yuèxià huājiàn jíxíng |titleEN =Moonlit Flower-Viewing Express |comment =TBD |translation =Winter is finally over. It really gives one the urge to go flower viewing!
The funny thing is, by the time Gensokyo returns to its usual peace, the Outside World has already welcomed a new era<ref>Between the game's official release and the update adding the Phantasm stage, the [[wikipedia:Reiwa|Reiwa]] era began in Japan.</ref>.
This track will also bring you a whole new vibe different from before, please enjoy! }}
{{MusicRoom |category =Phantasm Stage Boss - Suika Ibuki's Theme |title =地狱行乐 |roma =Dìyù xínglè |titleEN =Seeking Amusement in Hell |comment =TBD |translation =Original Track: [[Immaterial_and_Missing_Power/Music#Pre-battle_14|Broken Moon]]
Would a melody known by heart mixed with an unexpected style make for a pleasant breath of fresh air?
Since it's the extremely powerful oni, they must have a carefree and pleasant time in hell, right? }}
==Notes== {{reflist}}
{{Navbox FDF2}} [[Category:Fantastic Danmaku Festival Part II]] [[Category:Music by Game]] [[Category:Translations]]

==Music List== {{MusicRoom | category =Title Screen | title =幽遠の砂浜 | titleEN =Distant Sandy Beach | composer =しゃわ (Shower) | comment =タイトル画面のテーマです。 当初はトロピカルな感じで考えてたんですが
度重なる仕様変更により、常夏要素が影の形も無くなりました。
そんな事情が有り、背景のロケ地は夏の霧の湖へ移動。 (淡水の湖に砂浜なんてありましたっけ…？) | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is the title screen theme. I was originally thinking of a tropical theme,
but after various specification changes, I removed the "eternal summer" elements.
So I changed the title BG location to the Misty Lake in summer. (Do freshwater lakes ''have'' beaches...?) | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 Theme | title =ほおずきみたいに紅い魂 | titleEN =A Soul as Scarlet as a Ground Cherry | composer =よいやみ (Yoiyami) | comment =１面のテーマです。 夕闇のステージなので、紅魔郷から一曲。
のんきな巫女さん達の珍道中を現行仕様にしてみました。 曲がりなりにも宵闇の境内裏なので、アレが出ます。
夏と言えば納涼肝試しですが、彼女達の肝は… | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is the Stage 1 theme. It's an evening stage, so I took this song from EoSD.
I made the specifications this time 'a leisurely shrine maiden and friends on an incident-filled journey'. Since it's still technically a shrine ground at dusk, ''that'' shows up.
Summer may remind one of doing a trial of guts to cool off, but these girls' guts are... | note =Arranged from ''[[Embodiment_of_Scarlet_Devil/Music#Stage_1_theme|A Soul as Scarlet as a Ground Cherry]]'' from {{EoSD}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 1 Boss - [[Rumia]]'s Theme | title =妖魔夜行 | titleEN =Apparitions Stalk the Night | composer =よいやみ (Yoiyami) | comment =ルーミアのテーマです。 まあ彼女の曲と言えばこれ。説明不要です。
弾幕風ではお札を取ったEXルーミアの組み込み画像でお馴染みですが…。 本家STG本編での最後の出番が文花帖止まりですので、色々現代風に
アレンジしたりしてもらったりしました。様変わりしない程度に新作風。 | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is Rumia's theme. Well, this is definitely her theme song. No explanation needed.
Although Danmakufu's default image of EX-Rumia without her amulet is pretty familiar by now... Her last appearance in the official games was ''[[Shoot the Bullet]]'', so I had this song remixed
to be more modern. It's in a more recent style, but not dramatically different. | note =Arranged from ''[[Embodiment_of_Scarlet_Devil/Music#Stage_1_Boss_-_Rumia's_theme|Apparitions Stalk the Night]]'' from {{EoSD}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 Theme | title =運河を行き交う人妖 | titleEN =Humans and Youkai Traversing the Canal | composer =maceknight | comment =２面のテーマです。 PC殺しで(一部で)名高い柳の運河です。
コチラでも柳がハッスルしなければいいのですが…。 雨の日の河って個人的には近づきたくないんですよね。
なんだかフラフラ～と引き込まれそうで | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is the Stage 2 theme. The Canal of Willows, infamous (in some places) for murdering PCs.
As long as I don't make the willows hustle around fast, it should be fine, but... I personally wouldn't want to get near a river on a rainy day.
It just sort of feels like you'd wooobble and get pulled in. | note =Arranged from ''[[Double Dealing Character/Music#Stage_2_theme|Humans and Youkai Traversing the Canal]]'' from {{DDC}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 2 Boss - [[Nitori Kawashiro]]'s Theme | title =芥川龍之介の河童　～ Candid Friend | titleEN =Akutagawa Ryuunosuke's "Kappa" ~ Candid Friend | composer =古山智之 (khirio) | comment =河城 にとりのテーマです。 雨天な為、彼女のテンション120％でお送りしてます。
河童の気質(天候)ってやっぱり雨天なんですかね。 人里に近い運河の筈ですが、雨の日没の刻にわざわざ
出歩く人妖なんて妖精くらいなものでしょう。 | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is Nitori Kawashiro's theme. Since it's raining, she's coming at you with 120% excitement.
A kappa's temperament (weather) would surely be rainy. This canal is near the Human Village, but the only ones
traversing it during a rainy sunset would probably be fairies. | note =Arranged from ''[[Mountain of Faith/Music#Stage_3_boss_-_Nitori_Kawashiro's_theme|Akutagawa Ryuunosuke's "Kappa" ~ Candid Friend]]'' from {{MoF}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 Theme | title =夜の鳩山を飛ぶ　-Power MIX | titleEN =Fly Over Hatoyama at Night - Power MIX | composer =深蒼穹 (Misora) | comment =３面のテーマです。 風神録4面の滝ルートを表とするなら、このステージは山の裏側になります。
妖怪の山に滝が一つしかないとは言われてないので、裏にもあるという設定で。 実はすぐそばに中有の道があり、本当は生者向けの屋台とかもあるのですが
そんなモノ目にもくれずに頂上を目指していきます(純粋に忘れてただけ) | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is the Stage 3 theme. If the waterfall route in MoF stage 4 was the mountain's front, then this stage is the back.
It's never been stated how many waterfalls there are on the Youkai Mountain, so here, I put another in the back. The Road of Liminality is right behind it, with a bunch of shops for the living,
but we're headed for the top without paying any attention to them. (Actually I just forgot) | note =Arranged from ''Fly Over Hatoyama at Night - Power MIX'' from {{PMiSS|CD}}, which in turn is arranged from [[Shuusou Gyoku]]'s unused prototype. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 3 Boss - [[Kasen Ibaraki]]'s Theme | title =華狭間のバトルフィールド | titleEN =Battlefield of the Flower Threshold | composer =フランシウム (Francium) | comment =茨木 華扇のテーマです。 ついにあの仙人が弾幕STGに初登場！
深秘録で専用テーマも貰って、華扇ちゃんも喜んでいることでしょう。 実は神霊廟Exで公式に出演するはずだったそうなので、
この発想自体は結構古かったりします。残念。 | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is Kasen Ibaraki's theme. At last, that hermit makes her debut in a danmaku STG!
[[Urban Legend in Limbo|ULiL]] gave Kasen her own theme too, so she's bound to be happy. Apparently she was originally considered to appear in the EX stage of ''[[Ten Desires]]'',
so the idea itself is actually pretty old. What a shame. | note =Arranged from ''[[Urban Legend in Limbo/Music#Kasen_Ibaraki's_theme_.2F_Penultimate_Boss_theme|Battlefield of the Flower Threshold]]'' from {{ULiL}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4 Theme | title =龍神飛至蓬莱山　～ Oriental Mythology | titleEN =Dragon God Flying to Mount Hourai ~ Oriental Mythology | composer =緋子望 (Hishimottie) | comment =４面のテーマです。 神秘的で激し目の曲です。そして終盤になるほど高揚感。
今までとは一線を画した雰囲気をお楽しみください。 ほら、ドキドキしてきたでしょう？ | translation =The stage 4 theme. It's a mysterious and intense song that has that feeling of euphoria you'd expect when going towards the final stage.
Please enjoy the atmosphere that draws a line between the current and preceding stages. Yeah, see? Your heart's all aflutter, isn't it? | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4A Boss - [[Reimu Hakurei]]'s Theme | title =少女綺想曲　～ Capriccio | titleEN =Maiden's Capriccio | composer =NED | comment =博麗 霊夢のテーマです。 萃夢想版のリスペクトです。
イントロだけ聞くとコテコテの和風ですがそうでもありません。
割と落ち着いていて、霊夢には結構似合っている…のでしょうか？
これぞイーストサウンドって感じ。 | translation =Reimu Hakurei's theme. A homage to the [[Immaterial and Missing Power|IaMP]] version.
If you just listen to the intro, it sounds like it's in a super-heavy Japanese style, but the rest of it isn't, really.
It's relatively calm and relaxing, so it's a pretty good fit for Reimu... right?
A "now ''this'' is EastSound!" sort of feeling. | note =Arranged from ''[[Lotus Land Story/Music#Stage_4_Boss_A_-_Reimu's_theme|Maiden's Capriccio ~ Cappricio]]'' from {{LLS}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4B Boss - [[Marisa Kirisame]]'s Theme | title =魔女達の舞踏会 | titleEN =The Witches' Ball | composer =NED, Keith (Violin) | comment =霧雨 魔理沙のテーマです。 萃夢想版のリスペクトです。
金髪の魔女は今日も貧乏籤を引く役目を負わされます。
たまには報われてもいいんじゃないかなと思ったりもしますが
演出上仕方ないこともしばしばです。
あ、ソロバイオリンは生演奏です。 | translation =This is Marisa Kirisame's theme. A homage to the [[Immaterial and Missing Power|IaMP]] version.
Our blond-haired witch ends up drawing the short straw once again, in this game.
I do feel like she should get a break once in a while,
but a lot of the time it's an unavoidable consequence of the game's stage direction.
Oh, and the solo violin was performed live. | note =Arranged from ''[[Shuusou Gyoku/Music#Extra_Stage_Boss_.231_-_Marisa_Kirisame.27s_Theme|The Witches' Ball ~ Magus]]'' from {{SG}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4C Boss - [[Sakuya Izayoi]]'s Theme | title =フラワリングナイト | titleEN =Flowering Night | composer =NED | comment =十六夜 咲夜のテーマです。 緋想天版のリスペクトです。
弦楽器が随分頑張っています（笑）。
やはりメイドなので、ゴシックっぽさを出したいときには色々弦は便利です。
今日もメイドさんは右に左に大忙しです。 | translation =This is Sakuya Izayoi's theme. A homage to the [[Scarlet Weather Rhapsody|SWR]] version.
The strings are doing a lot of the heavy lifting here (lol).
She is a maid, after all, so having an ensemble of strings helps in giving the song a gothic feel.
Even today, the maid works hard left and right. | note =Arranged from ''[[Phantasmagoria of Flower View/Music#Sakuya_Izayoi's_theme|Flowering Night]]'' from {{PoFV}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4D Boss - [[Sanae Kochiya]]'s Theme | title =信仰は儚き人間の為に | titleEN =Faith is for the Transient People | composer =古山智之 (khirio) | comment =東風谷 早苗のテーマです。 毎度おなじみ、緑の風祝こと早苗さんです。
輝針城風のアレンジでお送りします。 今回の異変は妖怪の山から拡散していったので、
一番黒幕に近かった人なんですが、巡り巡って遠回りと…。 | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is Sanae Kochiya's theme. It's our all-too-familiar green wind priestess, Miss Sanae.
Her theme's been arranged in the style of ''[[Double Dealing Character]]''.
The incident this time had spread out starting at Youkai Mountain, so she was the closest in proximity to
the mastermind's location, but she ended up taking detours, bouncing around from one place to the next, and... | note =Arranged from ''[[Mountain of Faith/Music#Stage_5_boss_-_Sanae_Kochiya's_theme|Faith is for the Transient People]]'' from {{MoF}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4E Boss - [[Youmu Konpaku]]'s Theme | title =広有射怪鳥事　～ Till When? | titleEN =Hiroari Shoots a Strange Bird ~ Till When? | composer =古山智之 (khirio) | comment =魂魄 妖夢のテーマです。 何時も空回りしてたり、明後日の方向に飛んでいく
生真面目一徹な彼女ですが、今回は割と暢気気味？ 因みに肩からぶら下げているスイカは、
河に流れていたモノを修練用として拾ったとか | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is Youmu Konpaku's theme.
She's always taking fruitless turns or flying off in the wrong direction, but she seems
to be more than a little reckless this time around, doesn't she?
By the way, she found that watermelon hanging from her shoulder floating in a river,
and picked it up for a training regime. | note =Arranged from ''[[Perfect Cherry Blossom/Music#Stage_5_Boss_-_Youmu_Konpaku's_theme|Hiroari Shoots a Strange Bird ~ Till When?]]'' from {{PCB}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4F Boss - [[Yuuka Kazami]]'s Theme | title =幽夢　～ Inanimate Dream | titleEN =Faint Dream ~ Inanimate Dream | composer =NED | comment =風見 幽香のテーマです。 ジャズバンドっぽくアレンジしたつもりです。
幽香自体アダルティ強めな印象なので渋い所を色々目立たせようとしました。
しかしこの人何食べて生きてるんでしょうね。
霜…は流石にないか。うにせんとかですかね。 | translation =This is Yuuka Kazami's theme.
I had intended to arrange it in the style of a jazz band.
Yuuka herself gives off a strong "adult-y" impression, so I tried to highlight her austere side in various ways.
But I wonder, what kind of foods would she eat to survive...?
Frost? ...No, that's not something you'd expect from her. Sea urchin crackers, perhaps? | note =Arranged from ''[[Lotus Land Story/Music#Final_Boss_-_Yuuka's_theme_2|Faint Dream ~ Inanimate Dream]]'' from {{LLS}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 4G Boss - [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]]'s Theme | title =狂気の瞳　～ Invisible Full Moon | titleEN =Lunatic Eyes ~ Invisible Full Moon | composer =よいやみ (Yoiyami) | comment =鈴仙・優曇華院・イナバのテーマです。 最近やたらと公式ゲームで出番が貰えて、大活躍中の彼女です。
このゲームでも実質主役級の扱いと言っても過言ではないです。 弾幕はと言いますと、曲が紺珠伝風アレンジなので
「もし紺に鈴仙がボスで出たら？」という想像で作りました。他も同様ですが。 | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is Reisen Udongein Inaba's theme.
She's been playing a lot of active roles as of late, receiving plenty of playable opportunities in the official titles.
I'm not exaggerating when I say that this game treats her as the real star of the show.
In terms of danmaku, this song had been arranged in the style of ''[[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]'', so I had asked myself
"What if Reisen was a boss in LoLK?"; Her boss battle had been made with that in mind. The same goes for the others. | note =Arranged from ''[[Imperishable Night/Music#Stage_5_Boss_-_Reisen_Udongein_Inaba's_theme|Lunatic Eyes ~ Invisible Full Moon]]'' from {{IN}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 Theme | title =夜更けの表六甲 | titleEN =[[wikipedia:Rokkō_Arima_Ropeway|Omote-Rokkō]] at Night | composer =よいやみ (Yoiyami) | comment =５面のテーマです。 「あーあー、もう夜が明けちゃうぜー。」という夜更かし特有の
テンションイメージで選びました。時間的には午前３時半くらい？ 霊夢達は鍛えているので平気ですが、夜更かしは寿命を削るので
良い子は早めに寝ましょう。(朝方にこのテキストを書きながら) | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is the Stage 5 theme.
"Ah, it's almost dawn!!", I went with the tension of that sort of image, which is characteristic of those working late at night.
About 3:30 AM, time-wise?
It's fine for Reimu and company since they're all trained, but good children should go to bed
early because staying up late will shorten your lifespan (I say as I write this text early in the morning). | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 5 Boss - [[Tenshi Hinanawi]]'s Theme | title =有頂天変　～ Wonderful Heaven | titleEN =Catastrophe in Bhava-agra ~ Wonderful Heaven | composer =水月 (Suigetsu) | comment =比那名居 天子のテーマです。 寝起きを叩き起こされた所為で、少しご機嫌ナナメな模様。
天界でも格差があるらしいので、警備の人は眠れないのではないかと そう言えば、要石って斜めに刺すとどうなるんでしょうね。
テコの原理で地面がえぐれるんでしょうか。謎ですわ。 | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is Tenshi Hinanawi's theme.
She was woken up from her slumber, so it appears she's in a bit of a bad mood.
I heard that Heaven has some disparities of their own, so perhaps the people in defense don't get any sleep.
Come to think of it, I wonder what would happen if she stabbed a keystone slantwise?
Does the ground get hollowed out due to the principle of leverage? What a mystery... | note =Arranged from ''[[Scarlet Weather Rhapsody/Music#Tenshi_Hinanawi's_theme_.2F_Bhavaagra_theme|Catastrophe in Bhavaagra ~ Wonderful Heaven]]'' from {{SWR}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 Theme | title =故郷の星が映る海 | titleEN =The Sea that Reflects One's Home Planet | composer =よいやみ (Yoiyami) | comment =６面のテーマです。 紺珠伝の同名曲の風神録アレンジをお借りしました。
黒幕に至る疾走感を表したかったので、原作とは真逆の印象かも 因みに故郷の星というのは霊夢達目線ではなく
ボス目線でのお話です。あ、言わなくても判るか。 | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is the Stage 6 theme.
For this LoLK song, I borrowed the ''[[Mountain of Faith]]''-style arrangement of it.
I wanted to show the rapid pace leading up to the mastermind, so the impression might seem opposite of the original version.
In case you're wondering, the "Home Planet" part is not from Reimu and co's perspective, but from the boss's.
Oh, you don't need me to tell you that? | note =Arranged from ''[[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom/Music#Stage_6_theme|The Sea that Reflects One's Home Planet]]'' from {{LoLK}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 Boss (Part 1) - [[Ringo]]'s Theme | title =穏やかならぬ宴の兎 | titleEN =The Rabbit of the Unpeaceful Banquet | composer =しゃわ (Shower) | comment =鈴瑚(前半戦)のテーマです。 ちょっとした遊び半分で、様子見的なイメージです。
故に鈴瑚はあまり本気を出していません。 暇を持て余した玉兎の遊び。 | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is Ringo's first theme.
It's gotten a somewhat playful, wait-and-see kind of image.
Accordingly, Ringo isn't being very serious here.
A way of killing time for a moon rabbit with too much time on her hands. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Stage 6 Boss (Part 2) - [[Ringo]]'s Theme | title =玉兎と禁断の果実　～ Eden's Apple. | titleEN =The Moon Rabbit and the Forbidden Fruit ~ Eden's Apple. | composer =maceknight | comment =鈴瑚(後半戦)のテーマです。 天壌の収穫祭もクライマックス。
楽しくなってついつい本気を出した玉兎。
切なさや静けさと、騒々しさや荒々しさ
二つの面をもつ曲になったかなぁと。
さあ、楽死みましょう？ | translation =This is Ringo's second theme.
The Heaven-and-Earth Harvest Festival is at its climax!
A moon rabbit who got a little too serious in her playtime.
I think this song has two sides to it: the heartrending serene side, and the boisterous wild side.
Now, let's have a peaceful death, shall we? | note =Arranged from ''[[Legacy_of_Lunatic_Kingdom/Music#Stage_2_Boss_-_Ringo's_theme|September Pumpkin]]'' from {{LoLK}}.

Also features: *''[[Double Dealing Character/Music#Stage_6_Boss_-_Shinmyoumaru_Sukuna's_theme|Inchlings of the Shining Needle ~ Little Princess]]'' from {{DDC}} *''[[Mountain of Faith/Music#Stage_6_boss_-_Kanako_Yasaka's_theme|The Venerable Ancient Battlefield ~ Suwa Foughten Field]]'' from {{MoF}} *''[[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom/Music#Stage_6_Boss_-_Junko's_theme|Pure Furies ~ Whereabouts of the Heart]]'' from {{LoLK}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage Theme | title =魔法少女達の百年祭 | titleEN =The Centennial Festival for Magical Girls | composer =Prism | comment =エキストラステージのテーマです。 とにかく紺珠伝風を目指し、色々とこねくり回し過ぎてしまったので、
微妙な感じになっていないかちょっと心配です。
原曲に比べてテンポアップしているので、多少のスピード感は
感じていただけるかと思います。 | translation =This is the Extra Stage theme.
Anyway, I was aiming for the LoLK style, but I tweaked it in so many ways that
I'm a little worried it might be too subtle.
The tempo's been increased compared to the original song, so you can feel some sense of speed. | note =Arranged from ''[[Embodiment_of_Scarlet_Devil/Music#Extra_Stage_theme|The Centennial Festival for Magical Girls]]'' from {{EoSD}}. }} {{MusicRoom | category =Extra Stage Boss - [[Clownpiece]] and [[Flandre Scarlet]]'s Theme | title =星条旗のピエロは彼女なのか？ | titleEN =The Pierrot of the Star Spangled Banner was Her? | composer =中山奈那 (Nana Nakayama) | comment =クラウンピース＆フランドール・スカーレットのテーマです。 かわいい最狂コンビです。
２人で仲良く遊んでる雰囲気を出してみました。 ですが、人間からしたらもはや遊びではないですね、これ。 | translation =This is Clownpiece and Flandre Scarlet's theme.
They're the cutest, most insane duo!
I tried to convey a sense of two people playing together in a friendly manner.
But, from the perspective of a human, it's no longer a game. | note =A mashup of ''[[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom/Music#Stage 5_Boss_-_Clownpiece.27s_theme|Pierrot of the Star-Spangled Banner]]'' from {{LoLK}} and ''[[Embodiment_of_Scarlet_Devil/Music#Extra_Stage_Boss_-_Flandre_Scarlet.27s_theme|U.N Owen Was Her?]]'' from {{EoSD}} }} {{MusicRoom | category =Ending Theme | title =霊峰の眺め | titleEN =Scenery of the Sacred Peak | composer =緋子望 (Hishimottie) | comment =エンディングのテーマです。 やっぱり暗いです。帰り道ですしね。
一人で登山をした後の帰路はこんな感じだと思います。 私は体力がないので登山はしません。
一人だと寂しいしね。 | translation =This is the ending theme.
The mood is dark all the same. And during the return home too.
I think this is what it is like to return home after a solo hike in the mountains.
I don't do mountain-climbing since I don't have the stamina for it. And because I get lonely when I'm by myself. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Staff Roll Theme | title =遠い遠い幻想の砂浜 | titleEN =Sandy Beach of a Distant Fantasy | composer =しゃわ (Shower) | comment =スタッフロールのテーマです。 ゲームを作ってると、一番ほっとするシーンですね。
何せエフェクト出すだけですから、バグとも無縁ですし…。 あ、地味にタイトル画面のアレンジになっていますヨ。 | translation =(Comment by Gore.) This is the Staff Roll theme.
This is the most relieving scene when making a game.
After all, it's just placing down effects, so there's no need to worry about bugs...
Oh, and this is a modest arrangement of the title screen. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Name Register Theme | title =プレイヤーズスコア | titleEN =Player's Score | composer =NED | comment =ネームレジストのテーマです。 原作準拠なアレンジです。
なんか暗すぎて異世界にいる感じがします。
でも弾幕自体は明るくて楽しいですよ？ いつでも満足のいくゲームプレイをしたいものです。 | translation =This is the name registration theme.
An arrangement based on the original.
It's somewhat too dark, it makes me feel like I'm in a different world.
But the danmaku itself is cheery and fun, you know?
It's always good to have satisfying gameplay. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Last Word Theme | title =天の宴は今宵も華やかに | titleEN =The Heavenly Banquet is Gorgeous Once More Tonight | composer =maceknight | comment =ラストワードのテーマです。 おまけなので熱くなりすぎず、
でも本編の盛り上がりをそのままに。 異変は解決しているので力試しに遊んでいます。
曲は爽やかですが弾幕は濃厚ですよ。 | translation =This is the Last Word theme.
It's a bonus, so it's not too intense, but it maintains the excitement of the main story.
The incident's been resolved, so it's just play battles to test your strength.
The music is invigorating, but the danmaku is strong. | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Harvest Stage Theme | title =四季の華は太陽に踊る | titleEN =The Four Seasons' Flowers Dance in the Sun | composer =匙星 (Sajiboshi), NED | comment =ハーベストステージのテーマです。 主張をほとんどしてこない爽やかなテイストに仕上げました。 緊張感のない曲から繰り広げられる、緊張の弾幕。 さぁ、君も弾幕に踊れ！ | translation =This is the Harvest Stage theme.
We've made a refreshing style that hardly makes any assertions. Nerve-wracking danmaku of tension unfolds from a song free of tension.
You as well, come and dance with the danmaku! | note = }} {{MusicRoom | category =Harvest Stage Boss - [[Minoriko Aki|Minoriko]] and [[Shizuha Aki]]'s Theme | title =稲田姫様に叱られるから | titleEN =Because Princess Inada is Scolding Me | composer =NED | comment =秋姉妹のテーマです。 どうも原作だと小物にされがちな一面ボスを ちょっと強そうに描いてみました。 稲田姫の逆襲を味わってみてください。 | translation =This is the Aki Sisters' theme.
I tried to portray them as being a bit strong here, since stage 1 bosses like
them tend to be regarded as minor characters in the original series.
Please, have a taste of Inada-hime's counterattack. | note =Arranged from ''[[Mountain of Faith/Music#Stage_1_boss_-_Minoriko_Aki.27s_theme|Because Princess Inada is Scolding Me]]'' from {{MoF}}. }} {{Navbox FFF}} [[Category:Frantically Forbidden Fruit]] [[Category: Music by Game]]

==Music List== {{MusicRoom |category =Title Screen theme |title =幻想郷を覆う影 | roma =Gensōkyō wo ōu kage |titleEN =The Shadow Over Gensokyo A reference to ''[[wikipedia:The_Shadow_over_Innsmouth|"The Shadow over Innsmouth"]]'', a [[wikipedia:Cthulhu_Mythos|Cthulhu Mythos]] novella. |composer =Gizmo The Dragon (Arr. Tokiko Tatsunagi) |comment =タイトル画面のテーマです。
いつものタイトル曲より静かで厳粛な感じじゃないですか？
もうちょっと長くても良かったかもしれないけど、ぶっちゃけ思いつきで
作った曲です。トキコ氏のアレンジは、危険な旅に出るのを
ためらっているような雰囲気をとても上手く出してます。 | translation =The title screen theme.
This is quieter and more solemn than most title themes, don't you think?
Perhaps this piece could have been longer, but this is honestly one of those
spur-of-the-moment compositions. Tokiko's arrangement sets the tone very well,
as if you are hesitant to begin a very dangerous journey.
}} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 1 theme |title =蒼穹下ツアーへようこそ | roma =Soukyuuka tsuā e yōkoso |titleEN =Welcome to the Subsky Tour |composer =ZUN (Arr. Tokiko Tatsunagi) |comment =1面のテーマです。
「月面ツアーへようこそ」のアレンジです。
確かに原曲より元気な曲となりましたが、
元のふわふわでのんびりした感じも残っています。
（ベースをちょっとだけ使いすぎたかも知れませんが……）
| translation =The first stage theme.
This is arranged from "[[Welcome to the Moon Tour]]."
It's definitely livelier than before, but it still has that
floaty, laid-back feeling to it from the original song.
I think I may have went a little overboard on the bass, though...
}} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 1 Boss - [[Glory of Deep Skies/Characters#Aimi Sagigamori|Aimi Sagigamori]]'s theme |title =恥ずかしがり屋な五位鷺のプロミネンス | roma =Hazukashigariya na goisagi no purominensu |titleEN =Prominence of a Shy Heron |composer =Tokiko Tatsunagi |comment =鷺ヶ森 蒼海のテーマです。
キャラの方は確かに恥ずかしがりだけど、曲名の
「プロミネンス」の部分をちょっと意識しすぎたかもなー。
開発チームの皆様、私が既存の曲名に従って作曲するのを
二度と許さないでください | translation =Aimi Sagigamori's theme.
The character's definitely the shy kind, but I guess I focused
a little bit too much on the "Prominence" part of the song's title, huh?
Note to the developing team, please don't let me compose songs
based on existing titles. Ever again.
}} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 2 theme |title =夢世界の狂人酒場 | roma =Musekai no kyōjin sakaba |titleEN =Madman's Tavern of the Dream World |composer =ZUN (Arr. Tokiko Tatsunagi) |comment =２面のテーマです。
「旧世界の冒険酒場」のアレンジです。
テンポの速くてワイルドな感じのテーマが必要だったから、
これを選びました。原曲との違いは余りないですが、
よく考えると、そもそも狂気と酩酊の違いもそれほどないよね？ | translation =The second stage theme.
This is arranged from "[[Dateless_Bar_"Old_Adam"|Adventurer's Tavern of the Old World]]."
We needed a fast-paced, wild theme, so I decided on this one.
There isn't too much difference between this and the original song, but
then again, madness and drunkenness aren't much different to begin with, huh? }} {{MusicRoom |category =Stage 2 Boss - [[Glory of Deep Skies/Characters#Theone Phillips|Theone Phillips]] and [[Glory of Deep Skies/Characters#Aiguillon Gifttaenzer|Aiguillon Gifttaenzer]]'s theme |title =スターダストシャンブラー | roma =Sutādasuto shanberā |titleEN =Stardust Shambler |composer =Mana Kazami (Arr. Tokiko Tatsunagi) |comment =テオーネ・フィリップスとヱギヰヨン・ギフテンツァーのテーマです。
どうやらいつもの私のクセが全部"流れ"出たみたいです。
一つの曲がかかる時間に合わせて"スケール"するものかな？
とにかく……何故か、少し聞き慣れた気がする…？
奇妙な気持ちだな。私はまだ正気だよ、本当に。
……いやー、本当にそうかな？ | translation =Theone Phillips and Aiguillon Gifttaenzer's theme.
Somehow, all the kinds of stuff I usually do ended up just kind of [[White_Names_Spoiled_Past/Music#Extra_Stage_boss_-_Azuma_Himefuji.27s_theme|flowing]] out.
Maybe it [[White_Names_Spoiled_Past/Music#Extra_Stage_boss_-_Azuma_Himefuji.27s_theme|scales]] proportionally with how much time I spend on one song?
Either way... for some reason, I get the feeling it might be a bit familiar...?
That's a strange feeling. I'm not going insane, I promise.
